classes.name: PIXI.DisplayObject
classes.description:
The base class for all objects that are rendered. Contains properties for position, scaling,
rotation, masks and cache handling.

This is an abstract class and should not be used on its own, rather it should be extended.

It is used internally by the likes of PIXI.Sprite.

constructor.name: DisplayObject
constructor.description:
The base class for all objects that are rendered. Contains properties for position, scaling,
rotation, masks and cache handling.

This is an abstract class and should not be used on its own, rather it should be extended.

It is used internally by the likes of PIXI.Sprite.

members.name: position
members.description:
The coordinates, in pixels, of this DisplayObject, relative to its parent container.

The value of this property does not reflect any positioning happening further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldPosition` property.

members.name: scale
members.description:
The scale of this DisplayObject. A scale of 1:1 represents the DisplayObject
at its default size. A value of 0.5 would scale this DisplayObject by half, and so on.

The value of this property does not reflect any scaling happening further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldScale` property.

members.name: pivot
members.description:
The pivot point of this DisplayObject that it rotates around. The values are expressed
in pixel values.

members.name: rotation
members.description:
The rotation of this DisplayObject. The value is given, and expressed, in radians, and is based on
a right-handed orientation.

The value of this property does not reflect any rotation happening further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldRotation` property.

members.name: alpha
members.description:
The alpha value of this DisplayObject. A value of 1 is fully opaque. A value of 0 is transparent.
Please note that an object with an alpha value of 0 is skipped during the render pass.

The value of this property does not reflect any alpha values set further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldAlpha` property.

members.name: visible
members.description:
The visibility of this DisplayObject. A value of `false` makes the object invisible.
A value of `true` makes it visible. Please note that an object with a visible value of
`false` is skipped during the render pass. Equally a DisplayObject with visible false will
not render any of its children.

The value of this property does not reflect any visible values set further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldVisible` property.

members.name: hitArea
members.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

members.name: renderable
members.description:
Should this DisplayObject be rendered by the renderer? An object with a renderable value of
`false` is skipped during the render pass.

members.name: parent
members.description:
The parent DisplayObjectContainer that this DisplayObject is a child of.
All DisplayObjects must belong to a parent in order to be rendered.
The root parent is the Stage object. This property is set automatically when the
DisplayObject is added to, or removed from, a DisplayObjectContainer.

members.name: worldAlpha
members.description:
The multiplied alpha value of this DisplayObject. A value of 1 is fully opaque. A value of 0 is transparent.
This value is the calculated total, based on the alpha values of all parents of this DisplayObjects 
in the display list.

To obtain, and set, the local alpha value, see the `alpha` property.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.

members.name: worldTransform
members.description:
The current transform of this DisplayObject.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the transforms of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.

members.name: worldPosition
members.description:
The coordinates, in pixels, of this DisplayObject within the world.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the positions of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.

members.name: worldScale
members.description:
The global scale of this DisplayObject.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the scales of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.

members.name: worldRotation
members.description:
The rotation, in radians, of this DisplayObject.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the rotations of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.

members.name: filterArea
members.description: The rectangular area used by filters when rendering a shader for this DisplayObject.

members.name: x
members.description:
The horizontal position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.
If you need the world position of the DisplayObject, use `DisplayObject.worldPosition` instead.

members.name: y
members.description:
The vertical position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.
If you need the world position of the DisplayObject, use `DisplayObject.worldPosition` instead.

members.name: worldVisible
members.description: Indicates if this DisplayObject is visible, based on it, and all of its parents, `visible` property values.

members.name: mask
members.description:
Sets a mask for this DisplayObject. A mask is an instance of a Graphics object.
When applied it limits the visible area of this DisplayObject to the shape of the mask.
Under a Canvas renderer it uses shape clipping. Under a WebGL renderer it uses a Stencil Buffer.
To remove a mask, set this property to `null`.

members.name: filters
members.description:
Sets the filters for this DisplayObject. This is a WebGL only feature, and is ignored by the Canvas
Renderer. A filter is a shader applied to this DisplayObject. You can modify the placement of the filter
using `DisplayObject.filterArea`.

To remove filters, set this property to `null`.

Note: You cannot have a filter set, and a MULTIPLY Blend Mode active, at the same time. Setting a 
filter will reset this DisplayObjects blend mode to NORMAL.

members.name: cacheAsBitmap
members.description:
Sets if this DisplayObject should be cached as a bitmap.

When invoked it will take a snapshot of the DisplayObject, as it is at that moment, and store it 
in a RenderTexture. This is then used whenever this DisplayObject is rendered. It can provide a
performance benefit for complex, but static, DisplayObjects. I.e. those with lots of children.

Cached Bitmaps do not track their parents. If you update a property of this DisplayObject, it will not
re-generate the cached bitmap automatically. To do that you need to call `DisplayObject.updateCache`.

To remove a cached bitmap, set this property to `null`.

classes.name: PIXI.DisplayObjectContainer
classes.description:
A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects.
It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

constructor.name: DisplayObjectContainer
constructor.description:
A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects.
It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

functions.name: addChild
functions.description: Adds a child to the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: addChildAt
functions.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to place the child in

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: swapChildren
functions.description: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.

functions.name: getChildIndex
functions.description: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject instance to identify

returns.description: The index position of the child display object to identify

functions.name: setChildIndex
functions.description: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The resulting index number for the child display object

functions.name: getChildAt
functions.description: Returns the child at the specified index

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get the child from

returns.description: The child at the given index, if any.

functions.name: removeChild
functions.description: Removes a child from the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.description: The child that was removed.

functions.name: removeChildAt
functions.description: Removes a child from the specified index position.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get the child from

returns.description: The child that was removed.

functions.name: removeChildren
functions.description: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.description: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

functions.name: getBounds
functions.description: Retrieves the global bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

parameters.name: targetCoordinateSpace
parameters.description: Returns a rectangle that defines the area of the display object relative to the coordinate system of the targetCoordinateSpace object.

returns.description: The rectangular bounding area

functions.name: getLocalBounds
functions.description: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle without any transformations. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

returns.description: The rectangular bounding area

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Determines whether the specified display object is a child of the DisplayObjectContainer instance or the instance itself.

functions.name: _renderWebGL
functions.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer

functions.name: _renderCanvas
functions.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer

members.name: children
members.description: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

members.name: ignoreChildInput
members.description:
If `ignoreChildInput`  is `false` it will allow this objects _children_ to be considered as valid for Input events.

If this property is `true` then the children will _not_ be considered as valid for Input events.

Note that this property isn't recursive: only immediate children are influenced, it doesn't scan further down.

members.name: width
members.description: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

members.name: height
members.description: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

classes.name: PIXI.Sprite
classes.description: The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen

constructor.name: Sprite
constructor.description: The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen

parameters.name: texture
parameters.description: The texture for this sprite

functions.name: setTexture
functions.description:
Sets the texture of the sprite. Be warned that this doesn't remove or destroy the previous
texture this Sprite was using.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.description: The PIXI texture that is displayed by the sprite

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: Call Texture.destroy on the current texture before replacing it with the new one?

functions.name: onTextureUpdate
functions.description: When the texture is updated, this event will fire to update the scale and frame

functions.name: getBounds
functions.description:
Returns the bounds of the Sprite as a rectangle.
The bounds calculation takes the worldTransform into account.

It is important to note that the transform is not updated when you call this method.
So if this Sprite is the child of a Display Object which has had its transform
updated since the last render pass, those changes will not yet have been applied
to this Sprites worldTransform. If you need to ensure that all parent transforms
are factored into this getBounds operation then you should call `updateTransform`
on the root most object in this Sprites display list first.

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: the transformation matrix of the sprite

returns.description: the framing rectangle

functions.name: getLocalBounds
functions.description: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the Sprite as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

returns.description: The rectangular bounding area

functions.name: _renderWebGL
functions.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: - Optional matrix. If provided the Display Object will be rendered using this matrix, otherwise it will use its worldTransform.

functions.name: _renderCanvas
functions.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: - Optional matrix. If provided the Display Object will be rendered using this matrix, otherwise it will use its worldTransform.

functions.name: addChild
functions.description: Adds a child to the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: addChildAt
functions.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to place the child in

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: swapChildren
functions.description: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.

functions.name: getChildIndex
functions.description: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject instance to identify

returns.description: The index position of the child display object to identify

functions.name: setChildIndex
functions.description: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The resulting index number for the child display object

functions.name: getChildAt
functions.description: Returns the child at the specified index

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get the child from

returns.description: The child at the given index, if any.

functions.name: removeChild
functions.description: Removes a child from the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.description: The child that was removed.

functions.description: Removes a child from the specified index position.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get the child from

returns.description: The child that was removed.

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.description: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Determines whether the specified display object is a child of the DisplayObjectContainer instance or the instance itself.

members.name: anchor
members.description:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

members.name: texture
members.description: The texture that the sprite is using

members.name: _width
members.description: The width of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)

members.name: _height
members.description: The height of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)

members.name: tint
members.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

members.name: cachedTint
members.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

members.name: tintedTexture
members.description: A canvas that contains the tinted version of the Sprite (in Canvas mode, WebGL doesn't populate this)

members.name: blendMode
members.description:
The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

Warning: You cannot have a blend mode and a filter active on the same Sprite. Doing so will render the sprite invisible.

members.name: shader
members.description:
The shader that will be used to render this Sprite.
Set to null to remove a current shader.

members.name: exists
members.description: Controls if this Sprite is processed by the core Phaser game loops and Group loops.

members.name: width
members.description: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

members.name: height
members.description: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

members.name: children
members.description: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

members.name: ignoreChildInput
members.description:

members.name: y
members.description:
The vertical position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.
If you need the world position of the DisplayObject, use `DisplayObject.worldPosition` instead.

members.name: worldVisible
members.description: Indicates if this DisplayObject is visible, based on it, and all of its parents, `visible` property values.

members.name: mask
members.description:
Sets a mask for this DisplayObject. A mask is an instance of a Graphics object.
When applied it limits the visible area of this DisplayObject to the shape of the mask.
Under a Canvas renderer it uses shape clipping. Under a WebGL renderer it uses a Stencil Buffer.
To remove a mask, set this property to `null`.

members.name: filters
members.description:
Sets the filters for this DisplayObject. This is a WebGL only feature, and is ignored by the Canvas
Renderer. A filter is a shader applied to this DisplayObject. You can modify the placement of the filter
using `DisplayObject.filterArea`.

To remove filters, set this property to `null`.

Note: You cannot have a filter set, and a MULTIPLY Blend Mode active, at the same time. Setting a 
filter will reset this DisplayObjects blend mode to NORMAL.

members.name: cacheAsBitmap
members.description:
Sets if this DisplayObject should be cached as a bitmap.

When invoked it will take a snapshot of the DisplayObject, as it is at that moment, and store it 
in a RenderTexture. This is then used whenever this DisplayObject is rendered. It can provide a
performance benefit for complex, but static, DisplayObjects. I.e. those with lots of children.

Cached Bitmaps do not track their parents. If you update a property of this DisplayObject, it will not
re-generate the cached bitmap automatically. To do that you need to call `DisplayObject.updateCache`.

To remove a cached bitmap, set this property to `null`.

This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
If the Stage is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color.
If the Stage is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame.

classes.name: PIXI.WebGLRenderer
classes.description:
The WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs.
So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds.
Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

constructor.name: WebGLRenderer
constructor.description:
The WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs.
So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds.
Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the Phaser Game instance

functions.name: setTexturePriority
functions.description:
If Multi Texture support has been enabled, then calling this method will enable batching on the given
textures. The texture collection is an array of keys, that map to Phaser.Cache image entries.

The number of textures that can be batched is dependent on hardware. If you provide more textures
than can be batched by the GPU, then only those at the start of the array will be used. Generally
you shouldn't provide more than 16 textures to this method. You can check the hardware limit via the
`maxTextures` property.

You can also check the property `currentBatchedTextures` at any time, to see which textures are currently
being batched.

To stop all textures from being batched, call this method again with an empty array.

To change the textures being batched, call this method with a new array of image keys. The old ones
will all be purged out and no-longer batched, and the new ones enabled.

Note: Throws a warning if you haven't enabled Multiple Texture batching support in the Phaser Game config.

parameters.name: textureNameCollection
parameters.description: An Array of Texture Cache keys to use for multi-texture batching.

returns.description: An array containing the texture keys that were enabled for batching.

functions.description: Renders the stage to its webGL view

members.name: clearBeforeRender
members.description:
This sets if the WebGLRenderer will clear the context texture or not before the new render pass. If true:
If the Stage is NOT transparent, Pixi will clear to alpha (0, 0, 0, 0).
If the Stage is transparent, Pixi will clear to the target Stage's background color.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example: if your game has a canvas filling background image, you often don't need this set.

members.name: skipRender
members.description:
A BaseTexture can be set to skip the rendering phase in the WebGL Sprite Batch.

You may want to do this if you have a parent Sprite with no visible texture (i.e. uses the internal `__default` texture)
that has children that you do want to render, without causing a batch flush in the process.

classes.name: PIXI.PIXI
classes.description:
Namespace-class for [pixi.js](http://www.pixijs.com/).

Contains assorted static properties and enumerations.

constructor.name: PIXI
constructor.description:
Namespace-class for [pixi.js](http://www.pixijs.com/).

Contains assorted static properties and enumerations.

classes.name: Phaser.Animation
classes.description: An Animation instance contains a single animation and the controls to play it.It is created by the AnimationManager, consists of Animation.Frame objects and belongs to a single Game Object such as a Sprite.

constructor.name: Animation
constructor.description: An Animation instance contains a single animation and the controls to play it.It is created by the AnimationManager, consists of Animation.Frame objects and belongs to a single Game Object such as a Sprite.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: A reference to the owner of this Animation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique name for this animation, used in playback commands.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.description: The FrameData object that contains all frames used by this Animation.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: An array of numbers or strings indicating which frames to play in which order.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The speed at which the animation should play. The speed is given in frames per second.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.

functions.name: play
functions.description: Plays this animation.If you need to jump to a specific frame of this animation, then call `play` and immediately after it,set the frame you require (i.e. `animation.play(); animation.frame = 4`).

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The framerate to play the animation at. The speed is given in frames per second. If not provided the previously set frameRate of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: Should the animation be looped after playback. If not provided the previously set loop value of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: killOnComplete
parameters.description: If set to true when the animation completes (only happens if loop=false) the parent Sprite will be killed.

returns.description: - A reference to this Animation instance.

functions.name: restart
functions.description: Sets this animation back to the first frame and restarts the animation.

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Reverses the animation direction.

returns.description: The animation instance.

functions.name: reverseOnce
functions.description: Reverses the animation direction for the current/next animation onlyOnce the onComplete event is called this method will be called again and revertthe reversed state.

returns.description: The animation instance.

functions.name: setFrame
functions.description: Sets this animations playback to a given frame with the given ID.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: The identifier of the frame to set. Can be the name of the frame, the sprite index of the frame, or the animation-local frame index.

parameters.name: useLocalFrameIndex
parameters.description: If you provide a number for frameId, should it use the numeric indexes of the frameData, or the 0-indexed frame index local to the animation.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops playback of this animation and set it to a finished state. If a resetFrame is provided it will stop playback and set frame to the first in the animation.If `dispatchComplete` is true it will dispatch the complete events, otherwise they'll be ignored.

parameters.name: resetFrame
parameters.description: If true after the animation stops the currentFrame value will be set to the first frame in this animation.

parameters.name: dispatchComplete
parameters.description: Dispatch the Animation.onComplete and parent.onAnimationComplete events?

functions.name: onPause
functions.description: Called when the Game enters a paused state.

functions.name: onResume
functions.description: Called when the Game resumes from a paused state.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates this animation. Called automatically by the AnimationManager.

functions.name: updateCurrentFrame
functions.description: Changes the currentFrame per the _frameIndex, updates the display state,and triggers the update signal.Returns true if the current frame update was 'successful', false otherwise.

parameters.name: signalUpdate
parameters.description: If true the `Animation.onUpdate` signal will be dispatched.

parameters.name: fromPlay
parameters.description: Was this call made from the playing of a new animation?

returns.description: True if the current frame was updated, otherwise false.

functions.name: next
functions.description: Advances by the given number of frames in the Animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of frames to advance.

functions.name: previous
functions.description: Moves backwards the given number of frames in the Animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of frames to move back.

functions.name: updateFrameData
functions.description: Changes the FrameData object this Animation is using.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.description: The FrameData object that contains all frames used by this Animation.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Cleans up this animation ready for deletion. Nulls all values and references.

functions.name: complete
functions.description: Called internally when the animation finishes playback.Sets the isPlaying and isFinished states and dispatches the onAnimationComplete event if it exists on the parent and local onComplete event.

functions.name: generateFrameNames
functions.description: Really handy function for when you are creating arrays of animation data but it's using frame names and not numbers.For example imagine you've got 30 frames named: 'explosion_0001-large' to 'explosion_0030-large'You could use this function to generate those by doing: Phaser.Animation.generateFrameNames('explosion_', 1, 30, '-large', 4);

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The start of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be 'explosion_'.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The number to start sequentially counting from. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the start is 1.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.description: The number to count to. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the stop value is 34.

parameters.name: suffix
parameters.description: The end of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be '-large'.

parameters.name: zeroPad
parameters.description: The number of zeros to pad the min and max values with. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' then the zeroPad is 4.

returns.description: An array of framenames.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: _parent
members.description: A reference to the parent Sprite that owns this Animation.

members.name: _frameData
members.description: The FrameData the Animation uses.

members.name: name
members.description: The user defined name given to this Animation.

members.name: delay
members.description: The delay in ms between each frame of the Animation, based on the given frameRate.

members.name: loop
members.description: The loop state of the Animation.

members.name: loopCount
members.description: The number of times the animation has looped since it was last started.

members.name: killOnComplete
members.description: Should the parent of this Animation be killed when the animation completes?

members.name: isFinished
members.description: The finished state of the Animation. Set to true once playback completes, false during playback.

members.name: isPlaying
members.description: The playing state of the Animation. Set to false once playback completes, true during playback.

members.name: isPaused
members.description: The paused state of the Animation.

members.name: _pauseStartTime
members.description: The time the animation paused.

members.name: currentFrame
members.description: The currently displayed frame of the Animation.

members.name: onStart
members.description: This event is dispatched when this Animation starts playback.

members.name: onUpdate
members.description: This event is dispatched when the Animation changes frame.By default this event is disabled due to its intensive nature. Enable it with: `Animation.enableUpdate = true`.Note that the event is only dispatched with the current frame. In a low-FPS environment Animationswill automatically frame-skip to try and claw back time, so do not base your code on expecting toreceive a perfectly sequential set of frames from this event.

members.name: onComplete
members.description: This event is dispatched when this Animation completes playback. If the animation is set to loop this is never fired, listen for onLoop instead.

members.name: onLoop
members.description: This event is dispatched when this Animation loops.

members.name: isReversed
members.description: Indicates if the animation will play backwards.

members.name: paused
members.description: Gets and sets the paused state of this Animation.

members.name: reversed
members.description: Gets and sets the isReversed state of this Animation.

members.name: frameTotal
members.description: The total number of frames in the currently loaded FrameData, or -1 if no FrameData is loaded.

members.name: frame
members.description: Gets or sets the current frame index and updates the Texture Cache for display.

members.name: speed
members.description: Gets or sets the current speed of the animation in frames per second. Changing this in a playing animation will take effect from the next frame. Value must be greater than 0.

members.name: enableUpdate
members.description: Gets or sets if this animation will dispatch the onUpdate events upon changing frame.

classes.name: Phaser.AnimationManager
classes.description: The Animation Manager is used to add, play and update Phaser Animations.Any Game Object such as Phaser.Sprite that supports animation contains a single AnimationManager instance.

constructor.name: AnimationManager
constructor.description: The Animation Manager is used to add, play and update Phaser Animations.Any Game Object such as Phaser.Sprite that supports animation contains a single AnimationManager instance.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: A reference to the Game Object that owns this AnimationManager.

functions.name: loadFrameData
functions.description: Loads FrameData into the internal temporary vars and resets the frame index to zero.This is called automatically when a new Sprite is created.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.description: The FrameData set to load.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: The frame to default to.

returns.description: Returns `true` if the frame data was loaded successfully, otherwise `false`

functions.name: copyFrameData
functions.description: Loads FrameData into the internal temporary vars and resets the frame index to zero.This is called automatically when a new Sprite is created.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.description: The FrameData set to load.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: The frame to default to.

returns.description: Returns `true` if the frame data was loaded successfully, otherwise `false`

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds a new animation under the given key. Optionally set the frames, frame rate and loop.Animations added in this way are played back with the play function.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique (within this Sprite) name for the animation, i.e. "run", "fire", "walk".

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: An array of numbers/strings that correspond to the frames to add to this animation and in which order. e.g. [1, 2, 3] or ['run0', 'run1', run2]). If null then all frames will be used.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The speed at which the animation should play. The speed is given in frames per second.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.

parameters.name: useNumericIndex
parameters.description: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings?

returns.description: The Animation object that was created.

functions.name: validateFrames
functions.description: Check whether the frames in the given array are valid and exist.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: An array of frames to be validated.

parameters.name: useNumericIndex
parameters.description: Validate the frames based on their numeric index (true) or string index (false)

returns.description: True if all given Frames are valid, otherwise false.

functions.name: play
functions.description: Play an animation based on the given key. The animation should previously have been added via `animations.add`If the requested animation is already playing this request will be ignored. If you need to reset an already running animation do so directly on the Animation object itself.If you need to jump to a specific frame of this animation, then call `play` and immediately after it,set the frame you require (i.e. `animation.play(); animation.frame = 4`).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the animation to be played, e.g. "fire", "walk", "jump".

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The framerate to play the animation at. The speed is given in frames per second. If not provided the previously set frameRate of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: Should the animation be looped after playback. If not provided the previously set loop value of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: killOnComplete
parameters.description: If set to true when the animation completes (only happens if loop=false) the parent Sprite will be killed.

returns.description: A reference to playing Animation instance.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stop playback of an animation. If a name is given that specific animation is stopped, otherwise the current animation is stopped.The currentAnim property of the AnimationManager is automatically set to the animation given.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the animation to be stopped, e.g. "fire". If none is given the currently running animation is stopped.

parameters.name: resetFrame
parameters.description: When the animation is stopped should the currentFrame be set to the first frame of the animation (true) or paused on the last frame displayed (false)

functions.name: update
functions.description: The main update function is called by the Sprites update loop. It's responsible for updating animation frames and firing related events.

returns.description: True if a new animation frame has been set, otherwise false.

functions.name: next
functions.description: Advances by the given number of frames in the current animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of frames to advance.

functions.name: previous
functions.description: Moves backwards the given number of frames in the current animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of frames to move back.

functions.name: getAnimation
functions.description: Returns an animation that was previously added by name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the animation to be returned, e.g. "fire".

returns.description: The Animation instance, if found, otherwise null.

functions.name: refreshFrame
functions.description: Refreshes the current frame data back to the parent Sprite and also resets the texture data.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Destroys all references this AnimationManager contains.Iterates through the list of animations stored in this manager and calls destroy on each of them.

members.name: sprite
members.description: A reference to the parent Sprite that owns this AnimationManager.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: currentFrame
members.description: The currently displayed Frame of animation, if any.This property is only set once an Animation starts playing. Until that point it remains set as `null`.

members.name: currentAnim
members.description: The currently displayed animation, if any.

members.name: updateIfVisible
members.description: Update the animation data only while the the sprite is {@link Phaser.Sprite#visible}. Set to `false` to continue updating while the sprite is invisible.

members.name: isLoaded
members.description: Set to true once animation data has been loaded.

members.name: _frameData
members.description: A temp. var for holding the currently playing Animations FrameData.

members.name: _anims
members.description: An internal object that stores all of the Animation instances.

members.name: _outputFrames
members.description: An internal object to help avoid gc.

members.name: frameData
members.description: The current animations FrameData.

members.name: frameTotal
members.description: The total number of frames in the currently loaded FrameData, or -1 if no FrameData is loaded.

members.name: paused
members.description: Gets and sets the paused state of the current animation.

members.name: name
members.description: Gets the current animation name, if set.

members.name: frame
members.description: Gets or sets the current frame index and updates the Texture Cache for display.

members.name: frameName
members.description: Gets or sets the current frame name and updates the Texture Cache for display.

classes.name: Phaser.AnimationParser
classes.description: Responsible for parsing sprite sheet and JSON data into the internal FrameData format that Phaser uses for animations.

constructor.name: AnimationParser
constructor.description: Responsible for parsing sprite sheet and JSON data into the internal FrameData format that Phaser uses for animations.

functions.name: spriteSheet
functions.description: Parse a Sprite Sheet and extract the animation frame data from it.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Game.Cache asset key of the Sprite Sheet image or an actual HTML Image element.

parameters.name: frameWidth
parameters.description: The fixed width of each frame of the animation.

parameters.name: frameHeight
parameters.description: The fixed height of each frame of the animation.

parameters.name: frameMax
parameters.description: The total number of animation frames to extract from the Sprite Sheet. The default value of -1 means "extract all frames".

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: If the frames have been drawn with a margin, specify the amount here.

parameters.name: spacing
parameters.description: If the frames have been drawn with spacing between them, specify the amount here.

parameters.name: skipFrames
parameters.description: Skip a number of frames. Useful when there are multiple sprite sheets in one image.

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

functions.name: JSONData
functions.description: Parse the JSON data and extract the animation frame data from it.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: The JSON data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in Array format.

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

functions.name: JSONDataPyxel
functions.description: Parse the JSON data and extract the animation frame data from it.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: The JSON data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in Pyxel JSON format.

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

functions.name: JSONDataHash
functions.description: Parse the JSON data and extract the animation frame data from it.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: The JSON data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in JSON Hash format.

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

functions.name: XMLData
functions.description: Parse the XML data and extract the animation frame data from it.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: xml
parameters.description: The XML data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in Starling XML format.

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

classes.name: mat2d
classes.description:
A mat2d contains six elements defined as: 
[a, c, tx,
 b, d, ty]
This is a short form for the 3x3 matrix: 
[a, c, tx,
 b, d, ty,
 0, 0, 1]
The last row is ignored so the array is shorter and operations are faster.

constructor.name: mat2d
constructor.description:
A mat2d contains six elements defined as: 
[a, c, tx,
 b, d, ty]
This is a short form for the 3x3 matrix: 
[a, c, tx,
 b, d, ty,
 0, 0, 1]
The last row is ignored so the array is shorter and operations are faster.

classes.name: Phaser.Frame
classes.description: A Frame is a single frame of an animation and is part of a FrameData collection.

constructor.name: Frame
constructor.description: A Frame is a single frame of an animation and is part of a FrameData collection.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of this Frame within the FrameData set it is being added to.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X position of the frame within the texture image.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y position of the frame within the texture image.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the frame within the texture image.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height of the frame within the texture image.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the frame. In Texture Atlas data this is usually set to the filename.

functions.name: resize
functions.description: Adjusts of all the Frame properties based on the given width and height values.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The new width of the Frame.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The new height of the Frame.

functions.name: setTrim
functions.description: If the frame was trimmed when added to the Texture Atlas this records the trim and source data.

parameters.name: trimmed
parameters.description: If this frame was trimmed or not.

parameters.name: actualWidth
parameters.description: The width of the frame before being trimmed.

parameters.name: actualHeight
parameters.description: The height of the frame before being trimmed.

parameters.name: destX
parameters.description: The destination X position of the trimmed frame for display.

parameters.name: destY
parameters.description: The destination Y position of the trimmed frame for display.

parameters.name: destWidth
parameters.description: The destination width of the trimmed frame for display.

parameters.name: destHeight
parameters.description: The destination height of the trimmed frame for display.

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Clones this Frame into a new Phaser.Frame object and returns it.Note that all properties are cloned, including the name and index.

returns.description: An exact copy of this Frame object.

functions.name: getRect
functions.description: Returns a Rectangle set to the dimensions of this Frame.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: A rectangle to copy the frame dimensions to.

returns.description: A rectangle.

members.name: index
members.description: The index of this Frame within the FrameData set it is being added to.

members.name: x
members.description: X position within the image to cut from.

members.name: y
members.description: Y position within the image to cut from.

members.name: width
members.description: Width of the frame.

members.name: height
members.description: Height of the frame.

members.name: name
members.description: Useful for Texture Atlas files (is set to the filename value).

members.name: centerX
members.description: Center X position within the image to cut from.

members.name: centerY
members.description: Center Y position within the image to cut from.

members.name: distance
members.description: The distance from the top left to the bottom-right of this Frame.

members.name: rotated
members.description: Is the frame rotated in the source texture?

members.name: trimmed
members.description: Was it trimmed when packed?

members.name: sourceSizeW
members.description: Width of the original sprite before it was trimmed.

members.name: sourceSizeH
members.description: Height of the original sprite before it was trimmed.

members.name: spriteSourceSizeX
members.description: X position of the trimmed sprite inside original sprite.

members.name: spriteSourceSizeY
members.description: Y position of the trimmed sprite inside original sprite.

members.name: spriteSourceSizeW
members.description: Width of the trimmed sprite.

members.name: spriteSourceSizeH
members.description: Height of the trimmed sprite.

members.name: right
members.description: The right of the Frame (x + width).

members.name: bottom
members.description: The bottom of the frame (y + height).

classes.name: Phaser.FrameData
classes.description: FrameData is a container for Frame objects, which are the internal representation of animation data in Phaser.

constructor.name: FrameData
constructor.description: FrameData is a container for Frame objects, which are the internal representation of animation data in Phaser.

functions.name: addFrame
functions.description: Adds a new Frame to this FrameData collection. Typically called by the Animation.Parser and not directly.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: The frame to add to this FrameData set.

returns.description: The frame that was just added.

functions.name: getFrame
functions.description: Get a Frame by its numerical index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the frame you want to get.

returns.description: The frame, if found.

functions.name: getFrameByName
functions.description: Get a Frame by its frame name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the frame you want to get.

returns.description: The frame, if found.

functions.name: checkFrameName
functions.description: Check if there is a Frame with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the frame you want to check.

returns.description: True if the frame is found, otherwise false.

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Makes a copy of this FrameData including copies (not references) to all of the Frames it contains.

returns.description: A clone of this object, including clones of the Frame objects it contains.

functions.name: getFrameRange
functions.description: Returns a range of frames based on the given start and end frame indexes and returns them in an Array.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The starting frame index.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The ending frame index.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.

returns.description: An array of Frames between the start and end index values, or an empty array if none were found.

functions.name: getFrames
functions.description: Returns all of the Frames in this FrameData set where the frame index is found in the input array.The frames are returned in the output array, or if none is provided in a new Array object.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: An Array containing the indexes of the frames to retrieve. If the array is empty or undefined then all frames in the FrameData are returned.

parameters.name: useNumericIndex
parameters.description: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings? (false)

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.

returns.description: An array of all Frames in this FrameData set matching the given names or IDs.

functions.name: getFrameIndexes
functions.description: Returns all of the Frame indexes in this FrameData set.The frames indexes are returned in the output array, or if none is provided in a new Array object.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: An Array containing the indexes of the frames to retrieve. If undefined or the array is empty then all frames in the FrameData are returned.

parameters.name: useNumericIndex
parameters.description: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings? (false)

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.

returns.description: An array of all Frame indexes matching the given names or IDs.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Destroys this FrameData collection by nulling the _frames and _frameNames arrays.

members.name: _frames
members.description: Local array of frames.

members.name: _frameNames
members.description: Local array of frame names for name to index conversions.

members.name: total
members.description: The total number of frames in this FrameData set.

classes.name: Phaser.Camera
classes.description: A Camera is your view into the game world. It has a position and size and renders only those objects within its field of view.The game automatically creates a single Stage sized camera on boot. Move the camera around the world with Phaser.Camera.x/y

constructor.name: Camera
constructor.description: A Camera is your view into the game world. It has a position and size and renders only those objects within its field of view.The game automatically creates a single Stage sized camera on boot. Move the camera around the world with Phaser.Camera.x/y

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Game reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Not being used at the moment, will be when Phaser supports multiple camera

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Position of the camera on the X axis

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Position of the camera on the Y axis

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the view rectangle

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the view rectangle

functions.name: boot
functions.description: Called automatically by Phaser.World.

functions.name: preUpdate
functions.description: Camera preUpdate. Sets the total view counter to zero.

functions.name: follow
functions.description: Tell the camera which sprite to follow.You can set the follow type and a linear interpolation value.Use low lerp values (such as 0.1) to automatically smooth the camera motion.If you find you're getting a slight "jitter" effect when following a Sprite it's probably to do with sub-pixel rendering of the Sprite position.This can be disabled by setting `game.renderer.renderSession.roundPixels = true` to force full pixel rendering.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The object you want the camera to track. Set to null to not follow anything.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Leverage one of the existing "deadzone" presets. If you use a custom deadzone, ignore this parameter and manually specify the deadzone after calling follow().

parameters.name: lerpX
parameters.description: A value between 0 and 1. This value specifies the amount of linear interpolation to use when horizontally tracking the target. The closer the value to 1, the faster the camera will track.

parameters.name: lerpY
parameters.description: A value between 0 and 1. This value specifies the amount of linear interpolation to use when vertically tracking the target. The closer the value to 1, the faster the camera will track.

functions.name: unfollow
functions.description: Sets the Camera follow target to null, stopping it from following an object if it's doing so.

functions.name: focusOn
functions.description: Move the camera focus on a display object instantly.

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.description: The display object to focus the camera on. Must have visible x/y properties.

functions.name: focusOnXY
functions.description: Move the camera focus on a location instantly.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X position.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y position.

functions.name: shake
functions.description: This creates a camera shake effect. It works by applying a random amount of additionalspacing on the x and y axis each frame. You can control the intensity and durationof the effect, and if it should effect both axis or just one.When the shake effect ends the signal Camera.onShakeComplete is dispatched.

parameters.name: intensity
parameters.description: The intensity of the camera shake. Given as a percentage of the camera size representing the maximum distance that the camera can move while shaking.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration of the shake effect in milliseconds.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If a camera shake effect is already running and force is true it will replace the previous effect, resetting the duration.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The directions in which the camera can shake. Either Phaser.Camera.SHAKE_BOTH, Phaser.Camera.SHAKE_HORIZONTAL or Phaser.Camera.SHAKE_VERTICAL.

parameters.name: shakeBounds
parameters.description: Is the effect allowed to shake the camera beyond its bounds (if set?).

returns.description: True if the shake effect was started, otherwise false.

functions.name: flash
functions.description: This creates a camera flash effect. It works by filling the game with the solid fillcolor specified, and then fading it away to alpha 0 over the duration given.You can use this for things such as hit feedback effects.When the effect ends the signal Camera.onFlashComplete is dispatched.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the flash effect. I.e. 0xffffff for white, 0xff0000 for red, etc.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration of the flash effect in milliseconds.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If a camera flash or fade effect is already running and force is true it will replace the previous effect, resetting the duration.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The alpha value of the color applied to the flash effect.

returns.description: True if the effect was started, otherwise false.

functions.name: fade
functions.description: This creates a camera fade effect. It works by filling the game with thecolor specified, over the duration given, ending with a solid fill.You can use this for things such as transitioning to a new scene.The game will be left 'filled' at the end of this effect, likely obscuringeverything. In order to reset it you can call `Camera.resetFX` and it will clear thefade. Or you can call `Camera.flash` with the same color as the fade, and it willreverse the process, bringing the game back into view again.When the effect ends the signal Camera.onFadeComplete is dispatched.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color the game will fade to. I.e. 0x000000 for black, 0xff0000 for red, etc.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration of the fade in milliseconds.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If a camera flash or fade effect is already running and force is true it will replace the previous effect, resetting the duration.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The alpha value of the color applied to the fade effect.

returns.description: True if the effect was started, otherwise false.

functions.name: update
functions.description: The camera update loop. This is called automatically by the core game loop.

functions.name: updateFX
functions.description: Update the camera flash and fade effects.

functions.name: updateShake
functions.description: Update the camera shake effect.

functions.name: updateTarget
functions.description: Internal method that handles tracking a sprite.

functions.name: setBoundsToWorld
functions.description: Update the Camera bounds to match the game world.

functions.name: checkBounds
functions.description: Method called to ensure the camera doesn't venture outside of the game world.Called automatically by Camera.update.

functions.name: setPosition
functions.description: A helper function to set both the X and Y properties of the camera at oncewithout having to use game.camera.x and game.camera.y.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X position.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y position.

functions.name: setSize
functions.description: Sets the size of the view rectangle given the width and height in parameters.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The desired width.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The desired height.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the camera back to 0,0 and un-follows any object it may have been tracking.Also immediately resets any camera effects that may have been running such asshake, flash or fade.

functions.name: resetFX
functions.description: Resets any active FX, such as a fade or flash and immediately clears it.Useful to calling after a fade in order to remove the fade from the Stage.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: world
members.description: A reference to the game world.

members.name: id
members.description: Reserved for future multiple camera set-ups.

members.name: view
members.description: Camera view.The view into the world we wish to render (by default the game dimensions).The x/y values are in world coordinates, not screen coordinates, the width/height is how many pixels to render.Sprites outside of this view are not rendered if Sprite.autoCull is set to `true`. Otherwise they are always rendered.

members.name: bounds
members.description: The Camera is bound to this Rectangle and cannot move outside of it. By default it is enabled and set to the size of the World.The Rectangle can be located anywhere in the world and updated as often as you like. If you don't wish the Camera to be boundat all then set this to null. The values can be anything and are in World coordinates, with 0,0 being the top-left of the world. The Rectangle in which the Camera is bounded. Set to null to allow for movement anywhere.

members.name: deadzone
members.description: Moving inside this Rectangle will not cause the camera to move.

members.name: visible
members.description: Whether this camera is visible or not.

members.name: roundPx
members.description: If a Camera has roundPx set to `true` it will call `view.floor` as part of its update loop, keeping its boundary to integer values. Set this to `false` to disable this from happening.

members.name: atLimit
members.description: Whether this camera is flush with the World Bounds or not.

members.name: target
members.description: If the camera is tracking a Sprite, this is a reference to it, otherwise null.

members.name: displayObject
members.description: The display object to which all game objects are added. Set by World.boot.

members.name: scale
members.description: The scale of the display object to which all game objects are added. Set by World.boot.

members.name: totalInView
members.description: The total number of Sprites with `autoCull` set to `true` that are visible by this Camera.

members.name: lerp
members.description: The linear interpolation value to use when following a target.The default values of 1 means the camera will instantly snap to the target coordinates.A lower value, such as 0.1 means the camera will more slowly track the target, givinga smooth transition. You can set the horizontal and vertical values independently, and alsoadjust this value in real-time during your game.

members.name: onShakeComplete
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the camera shake effect completes.

members.name: onFlashComplete
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the camera flash effect completes.

members.name: onFadeComplete
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the camera fade effect completes.When the fade effect completes you will be left with the screen black (or whatevercolor you faded to). In order to reset this call `Camera.resetFX`. This is calledautomatically when you change State.

members.name: fx
members.description: The Graphics object used to handle camera fx such as fade and flash.

members.description: Internal point used to calculate target position.

members.name: _fxDuration

members.description: The FX type running.

members.description: The Cameras x coordinate. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds. Gets or sets the cameras x position.

members.name: y
members.description: The Cameras y coordinate. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds. Gets or sets the cameras y position.

members.name: position
members.description: The Cameras position. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds. Gets or sets the cameras xy position using Phaser.Point object.

members.name: height

classes.name: Phaser.Create
classes.description: The Phaser.Create class is a collection of smaller helper methods that allow you to generate game contentquickly and easily, without the need for any external files. You can create textures for sprites and incoming releases we'll add dynamic sound effect generation support as well (like sfxr).Access this via `Game.create` (`this.game.create` from within a State object)

constructor.name: Create
constructor.description: The Phaser.Create class is a collection of smaller helper methods that allow you to generate game contentquickly and easily, without the need for any external files. You can create textures for sprites and incoming releases we'll add dynamic sound effect generation support as well (like sfxr).Access this via `Game.create` (`this.game.create` from within a State object)

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Game reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: texture
functions.description: Generates a new PIXI.Texture from the given data, which can be applied to a Sprite.This allows you to create game graphics quickly and easily, with no external files but that use actual proper imagesrather than Phaser.Graphics objects, which are expensive to render and limited in scope.Each element of the array is a string holding the pixel color values, as mapped to one of the Phaser.Create PALETTE consts.For example:`var data = [  ' 333 ',  ' 777 ',  'E333E',  ' 333 ',  ' 3 3 '];``game.create.texture('bob', data);`The above will create a new texture called `bob`, which will look like a little man wearing a hat. You can then use itfor sprites the same way you use any other texture: `game.add.sprite(0, 0, 'bob');`

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key used to store this texture in the Phaser Cache.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: An array of pixel data.

parameters.name: pixelWidth
parameters.description: The width of each pixel.

parameters.name: pixelHeight
parameters.description: The height of each pixel.

parameters.name: palette
parameters.description: The palette to use when rendering the texture. One of the Phaser.Create.PALETTE consts.

returns.description: The newly generated texture.

functions.name: grid
functions.description: Creates a grid texture based on the given dimensions.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key used to store this texture in the Phaser Cache.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the grid in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the grid in pixels.

parameters.name: cellWidth
parameters.description: The width of the grid cells in pixels.

parameters.name: cellHeight
parameters.description: The height of the grid cells in pixels.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color to draw the grid lines in. Should be a Canvas supported color string like `#ff5500` or `rgba(200,50,3,0.5)`.

returns.description: The newly generated texture.

classes.name: Phaser.Filter
classes.description: This is a base Filter class to use for any Phaser filter development.If you want to make a custom filter, this should be your base class.The default uniforms, types and values for all Filters are:```resolution: { type: '2f', value: { x: 256, y: 256 }}time: { type: '1f', value: 0 }mouse: { type: '2f', value: { x: 0.0, y: 0.0 } }date: { type: '4fv', value: [ d.getFullYear(),  d.getMonth(),  d.getDate(), d.getHours() *60 * 60 + d.getMinutes() * 60 + d.getSeconds() ] }sampleRate: { type: '1f', value: 44100.0 }iChannel0: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }iChannel1: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }iChannel2: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }iChannel3: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }```The vast majority of filters (including all of those that ship with Phaser) use fragment shaders, andtherefore only work in WebGL and are not supported by Canvas at all.

constructor.name: Filter
constructor.description: This is a base Filter class to use for any Phaser filter development.If you want to make a custom filter, this should be your base class.The default uniforms, types and values for all Filters are:```resolution: { type: '2f', value: { x: 256, y: 256 }}time: { type: '1f', value: 0 }mouse: { type: '2f', value: { x: 0.0, y: 0.0 } }date: { type: '4fv', value: [ d.getFullYear(),  d.getMonth(),  d.getDate(), d.getHours() *60 * 60 + d.getMinutes() * 60 + d.getSeconds() ] }sampleRate: { type: '1f', value: 44100.0 }iChannel0: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }iChannel1: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }iChannel2: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }iChannel3: { type: 'sampler2D', value: null, textureData: { repeat: true } }```The vast majority of filters (including all of those that ship with Phaser) use fragment shaders, andtherefore only work in WebGL and are not supported by Canvas at all.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.description: Uniform mappings object. The uniforms are added on the default uniforms, or replace them if the keys are the same.

parameters.name: fragmentSrc
parameters.description: The fragment shader code. Either an array, one element per line of code, or a string.

functions.description: This should be over-ridden. Will receive a variable number of arguments.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the display.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the filter.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: A Pointer object to use for the filter. The coordinates are mapped to the mouse uniform.

functions.name: addToWorld
functions.description: Creates a new Phaser.Image object using a blank texture and assigns this Filter to it. The image is then added to the world.If you don't provide width and height values then Filter.width and Filter.height are used.If you do provide width and height values then this filter will be resized to match thosevalues.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate to place the Image at.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate to place the Image at.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the Image. If not specified (or null) it will use Filter.width. If specified Filter.width will be set to this value.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the Image. If not specified (or null) it will use Filter.height. If specified Filter.height will be set to this value.

parameters.name: anchorX
parameters.description: Set the x anchor point of the Image. A value between 0 and 1, where 0 is the top-left and 1 is bottom-right.

parameters.name: anchorY
parameters.description: Set the y anchor point of the Image. A value between 0 and 1, where 0 is the top-left and 1 is bottom-right.

returns.description: The newly added Image object.

functions.name: syncUniforms
functions.description: Syncs the uniforms between the class object and the shaders.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Clear down this Filter and null out references to game.

members.description: An array of passes - some filters contain a few steps this array simply stores the steps in a linear fashion.For example the blur filter has two passes blurX and blurY. An array of filter objects.

classes.name: Phaser.FlexGrid
classes.description: WARNING: This is an EXPERIMENTAL class. The API will change significantly in the coming versions and is incomplete.Please try to avoid using in production games with a long time to build.This is also why the documentation is incomplete.FlexGrid is a a responsive grid manager that works in conjunction with the ScaleManager RESIZE scaling mode and FlexLayersto provide for game object positioning in a responsive manner.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds an existing object as the top child in this group.The child is automatically added to the top of the group, and is displayed above every previous child.Or if the _optional_ index is specified, the child is added at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.If the child was already in this Group, it is simply returned, and nothing else happens to it.If `Group.enableBody` is set, then a physics body will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.If `Group.inputEnableChildren` is set, then an Input Handler will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.Use {@link Phaser.Group#addAt addAt} to control where a child is added. Use {@link Phaser.Group#create create} to create and add a new child.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to add as a child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index within the group to insert the child to. Where 0 is the bottom of the Group.

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

functions.name: addAt
functions.description: Adds an existing object to this group.The child is added to the group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.If `Group.enableBody` is set, then a physics body will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.If `Group.inputEnableChildren` is set, then an Input Handler will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to add as a child.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index within the group to insert the child to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

functions.name: addToHash
functions.description: Adds a child of this Group into the hash array.This call will return false if the child is not a child of this Group, or is already in the hash.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to add to this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group already and not present in the hash.

returns.description: True if the child was successfully added to the hash, otherwise false.

functions.name: removeFromHash
functions.description: Removes a child of this Group from the hash array.This call will return false if the child is not in the hash.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to remove from this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group and in the hash.

returns.description: True if the child was successfully removed from the hash, otherwise false.

functions.name: addMultiple
functions.description: Adds an array of existing Display Objects to this Group.The Display Objects are automatically added to the top of this Group, and will render on-top of everything already in this Group.As well as an array you can also pass another Group as the first argument. In this case all of the children from thatGroup will be removed from it and added into this Group.If `Group.enableBody` is set, then a physics body will be created on the objects, so long as one does not already exist.If `Group.inputEnableChildren` is set, then an Input Handler will be created on the objects, so long as one does not already exist.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: An array of display objects or a Phaser.Group. If a Group is given then *all* children will be moved from it.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.

returns.description: The array of children or Group of children that were added to this Group.

functions.name: getAt
functions.description: Returns the child found at the given index within this group.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to return the child from.

returns.description: The child that was found at the given index, or -1 for an invalid index.

functions.name: create
