functions.name: setInteractiveCandidateHandler
functions.description: Adds a callback that is fired every time `Pointer.processInteractiveObjects` is called.The purpose of `processInteractiveObjects` is to work out which Game Object the Pointer is going tointeract with. It works by polling all of the valid game objects, and then slowly discounting thosethat don't meet the criteria (i.e. they aren't under the Pointer, are disabled, invisible, etc).Eventually a short-list of 'candidates' is created. These are all of the Game Objects which are validfor input and overlap with the Pointer. If you need fine-grained control over which of the items isselected then you can use this callback to do so.The callback will be sent 3 parameters:1) A reference to the Phaser.Pointer object that is processing the Items.2) An array containing all potential interactive candidates. This is an array of `InputHandler` objects, not Sprites.3) The current 'favorite' candidate, based on its priorityID and position in the display list.Your callback MUST return one of the candidates sent to it.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback that will be called each time `Pointer.processInteractiveObjects` is called. Set to `null` to disable.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback will be called.

functions.name: addMoveCallback
functions.description: Adds a callback that is fired every time the activePointer receives a DOM move event such as a mousemove or touchmove.The callback will be sent 4 parameters:A reference to the Phaser.Pointer object that moved,The x position of the pointer,The y position,A boolean indicating if the movement was the result of a 'click' event (such as a mouse click or touch down).It will be called every time the activePointer moves, which in a multi-touch game can be a lot of times, so this is bestto only use if you've limited input to a single pointer (i.e. mouse or touch).The callback is added to the Phaser.Input.moveCallbacks array and should be removed with Phaser.Input.deleteMoveCallback.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback that will be called each time the activePointer receives a DOM move event.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback will be called.

functions.name: deleteMoveCallback
functions.description: Removes the callback from the Phaser.Input.moveCallbacks array.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback to be removed.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback exists.

functions.name: addPointer
functions.description: Add a new Pointer object to the Input Manager.By default Input creates 3 pointer objects: `mousePointer` (not include in part of general pointer pool), `pointer1` and `pointer2`.This method adds an additional pointer, up to a maximum of Phaser.Input.MAX_POINTERS (default of 10).

returns.description: The new Pointer object that was created; null if a new pointer could not be added.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the Input Manager. Called by the core Game loop.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Reset all of the Pointers and Input states.The optional `hard` parameter will reset any events or callbacks that may be bound.Input.reset is called automatically during a State change or if a game loses focus / visibility.To control control the reset manually set {@link Phaser.InputManager.resetLocked} to `true`.

parameters.name: hard
parameters.description: A soft reset won't reset any events or callbacks that are bound. A hard reset will.

functions.name: resetSpeed
functions.description: Resets the speed and old position properties.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Sets the oldPosition.x value.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Sets the oldPosition.y value.

functions.name: startPointer
functions.description: Find the first free Pointer object and start it, passing in the event data.This is called automatically by Phaser.Touch and Phaser.MSPointer.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event data from the Touch event.

returns.description: The Pointer object that was started or null if no Pointer object is available.

functions.name: updatePointer
functions.description: Updates the matching Pointer object, passing in the event data.This is called automatically and should not normally need to be invoked.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event data from the Touch event.

returns.description: The Pointer object that was updated; null if no pointer was updated.

functions.name: stopPointer
functions.description: Stops the matching Pointer object, passing in the event data.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event data from the Touch event.

returns.description: The Pointer object that was stopped or null if no Pointer object is available.

functions.name: getPointer
functions.description: Get the first Pointer with the given active state.

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: The state the Pointer should be in - active or inactive?

returns.description: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested state.

functions.name: getPointerFromIdentifier
functions.description: Get the Pointer object whos `identifier` property matches the given identifier value.The identifier property is not set until the Pointer has been used at least once, as its populated by the DOM event.Also it can change every time you press the pointer down, and is not fixed once set.Note: Not all browsers set the identifier property and it's not part of the W3C spec, so you may need getPointerFromId instead.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The Pointer.identifier value to search for.

returns.description: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested identifier.

functions.name: getPointerFromId
functions.description: Get the Pointer object whos `pointerId` property matches the given value.The pointerId property is not set until the Pointer has been used at least once, as its populated by the DOM event.Also it can change every time you press the pointer down if the browser recycles it.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: The `pointerId` (not 'id') value to search for.

returns.description: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested identifier.

functions.name: getLocalPosition
functions.description: This will return the local coordinates of the specified displayObject based on the given Pointer.

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to get the local coordinates for.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The Pointer to use in the check against the displayObject.

returns.description: A point containing the coordinates of the Pointer position relative to the DisplayObject.

functions.name: hitTest
functions.description: Tests if the pointer hits the given object.

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.description: The displayObject to test for a hit.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The pointer to use for the test.

parameters.name: localPoint
parameters.description: The local translated point.

functions.name: onClickTrampoline
functions.description: Used for click trampolines. See {@link Phaser.Pointer.addClickTrampoline}.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: hitCanvas
members.description: The canvas to which single pixels are drawn in order to perform pixel-perfect hit detection.

members.name: hitContext
members.description: The context of the pixel perfect hit canvas.

members.name: moveCallbacks
members.description: An array of callbacks that will be fired every time the activePointer receives a move event from the DOM.To add a callback to this array please use `Input.addMoveCallback`.

members.name: customCandidateHandler
members.description: See Input.setInteractiveCandidateHandler.

members.name: customCandidateHandlerContext
members.description: See Input.setInteractiveCandidateHandler.

members.name: pollRate
members.description: How often should the input pointers be checked for updates? A value of 0 means every single frame (60fps); a value of 1 means every other frame (30fps) and so on.

members.name: enabled
members.description: When enabled, input (eg. Keyboard, Mouse, Touch) will be processed - as long as the individual sources are enabled themselves.When not enabled, _all_ input sources are ignored. To disable just one type of input; for example, the Mouse, use `input.mouse.enabled = false`.

members.name: multiInputOverride
members.description: Controls the expected behavior when using a mouse and touch together on a multi-input device.

members.name: position
members.description: A point object representing the current position of the Pointer.

members.name: speed
members.description: A point object representing the speed of the Pointer. Only really useful in single Pointer games; otherwise see the Pointer objects directly.

members.name: circle
members.description: A Circle object centered on the x/y screen coordinates of the Input.Default size of 44px (Apples recommended "finger tip" size) but can be changed to anything.

members.name: scale
members.description: The scale by which all input coordinates are multiplied; calculated by the ScaleManager. In an un-scaled game the values will be x = 1 and y = 1.

members.name: maxPointers
members.description: The maximum number of Pointers allowed to be active at any one time. A value of -1 is only limited by the total number of pointers. For lots of games it's useful to set this to 1.

members.name: tapRate
members.description: The number of milliseconds that the Pointer has to be pressed down and then released to be considered a tap or click.

members.name: doubleTapRate
members.description: The number of milliseconds between taps of the same Pointer for it to be considered a double tap / click.

members.name: holdRate
members.description: The number of milliseconds that the Pointer has to be pressed down for it to fire a onHold event.

members.name: justPressedRate
members.description: The number of milliseconds below which the Pointer is considered justPressed.

members.name: justReleasedRate
members.description: The number of milliseconds below which the Pointer is considered justReleased .

members.name: recordPointerHistory
members.description: Sets if the Pointer objects should record a history of x/y coordinates they have passed through.The history is cleared each time the Pointer is pressed down.The history is updated at the rate specified in Input.pollRate

members.name: recordRate
members.description: The rate in milliseconds at which the Pointer objects should update their tracking history.

members.name: recordLimit
members.description: The total number of entries that can be recorded into the Pointer objects tracking history.If the Pointer is tracking one event every 100ms; then a trackLimit of 100 would store the last 10 seconds worth of history.

members.name: pointer1
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer2
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer3
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer4
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer5
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer6
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer7
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer8
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer9
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointer10
members.description: A Pointer object.

members.name: pointers
members.description: An array of non-mouse pointers that have been added to the game.The properties `pointer1..N` are aliases for `pointers[0..N-1]`.

members.name: activePointer
members.description: The most recently active Pointer object.When you've limited max pointers to 1 this will accurately be either the first finger touched or mouse.

members.name: mousePointer
members.description: The mouse has its own unique Phaser.Pointer object which you can use if making a desktop specific game.

members.name: mouse
members.description: The Mouse Input manager.You should not usually access this manager directly, but instead use Input.mousePointer or Input.activePointer which normalizes all the input values for you, regardless of browser.

members.name: keyboard
members.description: The Keyboard Input manager.

members.name: touch
members.description: The Touch Input manager.You should not usually access this manager directly, but instead use Input.activePointer which normalizes all the input values for you, regardless of browser.

members.name: mspointer
members.description: The MSPointer Input manager.You should not usually access this manager directly, but instead use Input.activePointer which normalizes all the input values for you, regardless of browser.

members.name: gamepad
members.description: The Gamepad Input manager.

members.name: resetLocked
members.description: If the Input Manager has been reset locked then all calls made to InputManager.reset, such as from a State change, are ignored.

members.name: onDown
members.description: A Signal that is dispatched each time a pointer is pressed down.

members.name: onUp
members.description: A Signal that is dispatched each time a pointer is released.

members.name: onTap
members.description: A Signal that is dispatched each time a pointer is tapped.

members.name: onHold
members.description: A Signal that is dispatched each time a pointer is held down.

members.name: minPriorityID
members.description: You can tell all Pointers to ignore any Game Object with a `priorityID` lower than this value.This is useful when stacking UI layers. Set to zero to disable.

members.name: interactiveItems
members.description: A list of interactive objects. The InputHandler components add and remove themselves from this list.

members.name: _localPoint
members.description: Internal cache var.

members.name: _pollCounter
members.description: Internal var holding the current poll counter.

members.name: _oldPosition
members.description: A point object representing the previous position of the Pointer.

members.name: _x
members.description: x coordinate of the most recent Pointer event

members.name: _y
members.description: Y coordinate of the most recent Pointer event

members.name: MAX_POINTERS
members.description: The maximum number of pointers that can be added. This excludes the mouse pointer.

members.name: countActivePointers
members.description: Returns the total number of active pointers, not exceeding the specified limit

members.name: x
members.description: The X coordinate of the most recently active pointer.This value takes game scaling into account automatically. See Pointer.screenX/clientX for source values.

members.name: y
members.description: The Y coordinate of the most recently active pointer.This value takes game scaling into account automatically. See Pointer.screenY/clientY for source values.

members.name: pollLocked
members.description: True if the Input is currently poll rate locked.

members.name: totalInactivePointers
members.description: The total number of inactive Pointers.

members.name: totalActivePointers
members.description: The total number of active Pointers, not counting the mouse pointer.

members.name: worldX
members.description: The world X coordinate of the most recently active pointer.

members.name: worldY
members.description: The world Y coordinate of the most recently active pointer.

classes.name: Phaser.InputHandler
classes.description: The Input Handler is bound to a specific Sprite and is responsible for managing all Input events on that Sprite.

constructor.name: InputHandler
constructor.description: The Input Handler is bound to a specific Sprite and is responsible for managing all Input events on that Sprite.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: The Sprite object to which this Input Handler belongs.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the Input Handler running. This is called automatically when you enable input on a Sprite, or can be called directly if you need to set a specific priority.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Higher priority sprites take click priority over low-priority sprites when they are stacked on-top of each other.

parameters.name: useHandCursor
parameters.description: If true the Sprite will show the hand cursor on mouse-over (doesn't apply to mobile browsers)

returns.description: The Sprite object to which the Input Handler is bound.

functions.name: addedToGroup
functions.description: Handles when the parent Sprite is added to a new Group.

functions.name: removedFromGroup
functions.description: Handles when the parent Sprite is removed from a Group.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the Input Handler and disables it.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops the Input Handler from running.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Clean up memory.

functions.name: validForInput
functions.description: Checks if the object this InputHandler is bound to is valid for consideration in the Pointer move event.This is called by Phaser.Pointer and shouldn't typically be called directly.

parameters.name: highestID
parameters.description: The highest ID currently processed by the Pointer.

parameters.name: highestRenderID
parameters.description: The highest Render Order ID currently processed by the Pointer.

parameters.name: includePixelPerfect
parameters.description: If this object has `pixelPerfectClick` or `pixelPerfectOver` set should it be considered as valid?

returns.description: True if the object this InputHandler is bound to should be considered as valid for input detection.

functions.name: isPixelPerfect
functions.description: Is this object using pixel perfect checking?

returns.description: True if the this InputHandler has either `pixelPerfectClick` or `pixelPerfectOver` set to `true`.

functions.name: pointerX
functions.description: The x coordinate of the Input pointer, relative to the top-left of the parent Sprite.This value is only set when the pointer is over this Sprite.

returns.description: The x coordinate of the Input pointer.

functions.name: pointerY
functions.description: The y coordinate of the Input pointer, relative to the top-left of the parent SpriteThis value is only set when the pointer is over this Sprite.

returns.description: The y coordinate of the Input pointer.

functions.name: pointerDown
functions.description: If the Pointer is down this returns true.This *only* checks if the Pointer is down, not if it's down over any specific Sprite.

returns.description: - True if the given pointer is down, otherwise false.

functions.name: pointerUp
functions.description: If the Pointer is up this returns true.This *only* checks if the Pointer is up, not if it's up over any specific Sprite.

returns.description: - True if the given pointer is up, otherwise false.

functions.name: pointerTimeDown
functions.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer first touched the touchscreen.

functions.name: pointerTimeUp
functions.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer left the touchscreen.

functions.name: pointerOver
functions.description: Is the Pointer over this Sprite?

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: The ID number of a Pointer to check. If you don't provide a number it will check all Pointers.

returns.description: - True if the given pointer (if a index was given, or any pointer if not) is over this object.

functions.name: pointerOut
functions.description: Is the Pointer outside of this Sprite?

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: The ID number of a Pointer to check. If you don't provide a number it will check all Pointers.

returns.description: True if the given pointer (if a index was given, or any pointer if not) is out of this object.

functions.name: pointerTimeOver
functions.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer first touched the touchscreen.

functions.name: pointerTimeOut
functions.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer left the touchscreen.

functions.name: pointerDragged
functions.description: Is this sprite being dragged by the mouse or not?

returns.description: True if the pointer is dragging an object, otherwise false.

functions.name: checkPointerDown
functions.description: Checks if the given pointer is both down and over the Sprite this InputHandler belongs to.Use the `fastTest` flag is to quickly check just the bounding hit area even if `InputHandler.pixelPerfectOver` is `true`.

parameters.name: fastTest
parameters.description: Force a simple hit area check even if `pixelPerfectOver` is true for this object?

returns.description: True if the pointer is down, otherwise false.

functions.name: checkPointerOver
functions.description: Checks if the given pointer is over the Sprite this InputHandler belongs to.Use the `fastTest` flag is to quickly check just the bounding hit area even if `InputHandler.pixelPerfectOver` is `true`.

parameters.name: fastTest
parameters.description: Force a simple hit area check even if `pixelPerfectOver` is true for this object?

functions.name: checkPixel
functions.description: Runs a pixel perfect check against the given x/y coordinates of the Sprite this InputHandler is bound to.It compares the alpha value of the pixel and if >= InputHandler.pixelPerfectAlpha it returns true.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate to check.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate to check.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The pointer to get the x/y coordinate from if not passed as the first two parameters.

returns.description: true if there is the alpha of the pixel is >= InputHandler.pixelPerfectAlpha

functions.name: update
functions.description: Internal Update method. This is called automatically and handles the Pointerand drag update loops.

returns.description: True if the pointer is still active, otherwise false.

functions.name: _pointerOverHandler
functions.description: Internal method handling the pointer over event.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The pointer that triggered the event

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If silent is `true` then this method will not dispatch any Signals from the parent Sprite.

functions.name: _pointerOutHandler
functions.description: Internal method handling the pointer out event.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The pointer that triggered the event.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If silent is `true` then this method will not dispatch any Signals from the parent Sprite.

functions.name: _touchedHandler
functions.description: Internal method handling the touched / clicked event.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The pointer that triggered the event.

functions.name: dragTimeElapsed
functions.description: Internal method handling the drag threshold timer.

functions.name: _releasedHandler
functions.description: Internal method handling the pointer released event.

functions.name: updateDrag
functions.description: Called as a Pointer actively drags this Game Object.

parameters.name: pointer
parameters.description: The Pointer causing the drag update.

parameters.name: fromStart
parameters.description: True if this is the first update, immediately after the drag has started.

functions.name: justOver
functions.description: Returns true if the pointer has entered the Sprite within the specified delay time (defaults to 500ms, half a second)

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: The time below which the pointer is considered as just over.

functions.name: justOut
functions.description: Returns true if the pointer has left the Sprite within the specified delay time (defaults to 500ms, half a second)

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: The time below which the pointer is considered as just out.

functions.name: justPressed
functions.description: Returns true if the pointer has touched or clicked on the Sprite within the specified delay time (defaults to 500ms, half a second)

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: The time below which the pointer is considered as just over.

functions.name: justReleased
functions.description: Returns true if the pointer was touching this Sprite, but has been released within the specified delay time (defaults to 500ms, half a second)

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: The time below which the pointer is considered as just out.

functions.name: overDuration
functions.description: If the pointer is currently over this Sprite this returns how long it has been there for in milliseconds.

returns.description: The number of milliseconds the pointer has been over the Sprite, or -1 if not over.

functions.name: downDuration
functions.description: If the pointer is currently over this Sprite this returns how long it has been there for in milliseconds.

returns.description: The number of milliseconds the pointer has been pressed down on the Sprite, or -1 if not over.

functions.name: enableDrag
functions.description: Allow this Sprite to be dragged by any valid pointer.When the drag begins the Sprite.events.onDragStart event will be dispatched.When the drag completes by way of the user letting go of the pointer that was dragging the sprite, the Sprite.events.onDragStop event is dispatched.You can control the thresholds over when a drag starts via the properties:`Pointer.dragDistanceThreshold` the distance, in pixels, that the pointer has to movebefore the drag will start.`Pointer.dragTimeThreshold` the time, in ms, that the pointer must be held down onthe Sprite before the drag will start.You can set either (or both) of these properties after enabling a Sprite for drag.For the duration of the drag the Sprite.events.onDragUpdate event is dispatched. This event is only dispatched when the pointer actuallychanges position and moves. The event sends 5 parameters: `sprite`, `pointer`, `dragX`, `dragY` and `snapPoint`.

parameters.name: lockCenter
parameters.description: If false the Sprite will drag from where you click it minus the dragOffset. If true it will center itself to the tip of the mouse pointer.

parameters.name: bringToTop
parameters.description: If true the Sprite will be bought to the top of the rendering list in its current Group.

parameters.name: pixelPerfect
parameters.description: If true it will use a pixel perfect test to see if you clicked the Sprite. False uses the bounding box.

parameters.name: alphaThreshold
parameters.description: If using pixel perfect collision this specifies the alpha level from 0 to 255 above which a collision is processed.

parameters.name: boundsRect
parameters.description: If you want to restrict the drag of this sprite to a specific Rectangle, pass the Phaser.Rectangle here, otherwise it's free to drag anywhere.

parameters.name: boundsSprite
parameters.description: If you want to restrict the drag of this sprite to within the bounding box of another sprite, pass it here.

functions.name: disableDrag
functions.description: Stops this sprite from being able to be dragged.If it is currently the target of an active drag it will be stopped immediately; also disables any set callbacks.

functions.name: startDrag
functions.description: Called by Pointer when drag starts on this Sprite. Should not usually be called directly.

functions.name: globalToLocalX
functions.description: Warning: EXPERIMENTAL

functions.name: globalToLocalY
functions.description: Warning: EXPERIMENTAL

functions.name: stopDrag
functions.description: Called by Pointer when drag is stopped on this Sprite. Should not usually be called directly.

functions.name: setDragLock
functions.description: Restricts this sprite to drag movement only on the given axis. Note: If both are set to false the sprite will never move!

parameters.name: allowHorizontal
parameters.description: To enable the sprite to be dragged horizontally set to true, otherwise false.

parameters.name: allowVertical
parameters.description: To enable the sprite to be dragged vertically set to true, otherwise false.

functions.name: enableSnap
functions.description: Make this Sprite snap to the given grid either during drag or when it's released.For example 16x16 as the snapX and snapY would make the sprite snap to every 16 pixels.

parameters.name: snapX
parameters.description: The width of the grid cell to snap to.

parameters.name: snapY
parameters.description: The height of the grid cell to snap to.

parameters.name: onDrag
parameters.description: If true the sprite will snap to the grid while being dragged.

parameters.name: onRelease
parameters.description: If true the sprite will snap to the grid when released.

parameters.name: snapOffsetX
parameters.description: Used to offset the top-left starting point of the snap grid.

parameters.name: snapOffsetY
parameters.description: Used to offset the top-left starting point of the snap grid.

functions.name: disableSnap
functions.description: Stops the sprite from snapping to a grid during drag or release.

functions.name: checkBoundsRect
functions.description: Bounds Rect check for the sprite drag

functions.name: checkBoundsSprite
functions.description: Parent Sprite Bounds check for the sprite drag.

members.name: sprite
members.description: The Sprite object to which this Input Handler belongs.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: enabled
members.description: If enabled the Input Handler will process input requests and monitor pointer activity.

members.name: checked
members.description: A disposable flag used by the Pointer class when performing priority checks.

members.name: priorityID
members.description: The priorityID is used to determine which game objects should get priority when input events occur. For example if you haveseveral Sprites that overlap, by default the one at the top of the display list is given priority for input events. You canstop this from happening by controlling the priorityID value. The higher the value, the more important they are considered to the Input events.

members.name: useHandCursor
members.description: On a desktop browser you can set the 'hand' cursor to appear when moving over the Sprite.

members.name: _setHandCursor
members.description: Did this Sprite trigger the hand cursor?

members.name: isDragged
members.description: true if the Sprite is being currently dragged.

members.name: allowHorizontalDrag
members.description: Controls if the Sprite is allowed to be dragged horizontally.

members.name: allowVerticalDrag
members.description: Controls if the Sprite is allowed to be dragged vertically.

members.name: bringToTop
members.description: If true when this Sprite is clicked or dragged it will automatically be bought to the top of the Group it is within.

members.name: snapOffset
members.description: A Point object that contains by how far the Sprite snap is offset.

members.name: snapOnDrag
members.description: When the Sprite is dragged this controls if the center of the Sprite will snap to the pointer on drag or not.

members.name: snapOnRelease
members.description: When the Sprite is dragged this controls if the Sprite will be snapped on release.

members.name: snapX
members.description: When a Sprite has snapping enabled this holds the width of the snap grid.

members.name: snapY
members.description: When a Sprite has snapping enabled this holds the height of the snap grid.

members.name: snapOffsetX
members.description: This defines the top-left X coordinate of the snap grid.

members.name: snapOffsetY
members.description: This defines the top-left Y coordinate of the snap grid..

members.name: pixelPerfectOver
members.description: Set to true to use pixel perfect hit detection when checking if the pointer is over this Sprite.The x/y coordinates of the pointer are tested against the image in combination with the InputHandler.pixelPerfectAlpha value.This feature only works for display objects with image based textures such as Sprites. It won't work on BitmapText or Rope.Warning: This is expensive, especially on mobile (where it's not even needed!) so only enable if required. Also see the less-expensive InputHandler.pixelPerfectClick. Use a pixel perfect check when testing for pointer over.

members.name: pixelPerfectClick
members.description: Set to true to use pixel perfect hit detection when checking if the pointer is over this Sprite when it's clicked or touched.The x/y coordinates of the pointer are tested against the image in combination with the InputHandler.pixelPerfectAlpha value.This feature only works for display objects with image based textures such as Sprites. It won't work on BitmapText or Rope.Warning: This is expensive so only enable if you really need it. Use a pixel perfect check when testing for clicks or touches on the Sprite.

members.name: pixelPerfectAlpha
members.description: The alpha tolerance threshold. If the alpha value of the pixel matches or is above this value, it's considered a hit.

members.name: draggable
members.description: Is this sprite allowed to be dragged by the mouse? true = yes, false = no

members.name: boundsRect
members.description: A region of the game world within which the sprite is restricted during drag.

members.name: boundsSprite
members.description: A Sprite the bounds of which this sprite is restricted during drag.

members.name: scaleLayer
members.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Please do not use this property unless you know what it does. Likely to change in the future.

members.name: dragOffset
members.description: The offset from the Sprites position that dragging takes place from.

members.name: dragFromCenter
members.description: Is the Sprite dragged from its center, or the point at which the Pointer was pressed down upon it?

members.name: dragStopBlocksInputUp
members.description: If enabled, when the Sprite stops being dragged, it will only dispatch the `onDragStop` event, and not the `onInputUp` event. If set to `false` it will dispatch both events.

members.name: dragStartPoint
members.description: The Point from which the most recent drag started from. Useful if you need to return an object to its starting position.

members.name: dragDistanceThreshold
members.description: The distance, in pixels, the pointer has to move while being held down, before the Sprite thinks it is being dragged.

members.name: dragTimeThreshold
members.description: The amount of time, in ms, the pointer has to be held down over the Sprite before it thinks it is being dragged.

members.name: downPoint
members.description: A Point object containing the coordinates of the Pointer when it was first pressed down onto this Sprite.

members.name: snapPoint
members.description: If the sprite is set to snap while dragging this holds the point of the most recent 'snap' event.

classes.name: Phaser.Key
classes.description: If you need more fine-grained control over the handling of specific keys you can create and use Phaser.Key objects.

constructor.name: Key
constructor.description: If you need more fine-grained control over the handling of specific keys you can create and use Phaser.Key objects.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Current game instance.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The key code this Key is responsible for. See {@link Phaser.KeyCode}.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Called automatically by Phaser.Keyboard.

functions.name: processKeyDown
functions.description: Called automatically by Phaser.Keyboard.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The DOM event that triggered this.

functions.name: processKeyUp
functions.description: Called automatically by Phaser.Keyboard.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The DOM event that triggered this.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the state of this Key.This sets isDown to false, isUp to true, resets the time to be the current time, and _enables_ the key.In addition, if it is a "hard reset", it clears clears any callbacks associated with the onDown and onUp events and removes the onHoldCallback.

parameters.name: hard
parameters.description: A soft reset won't reset any events or callbacks; a hard reset will.

functions.name: downDuration
functions.description: Returns `true` if the Key was pressed down within the `duration` value given, or `false` if it either isn't down,or was pressed down longer ago than then given duration.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration within which the key is considered as being just pressed. Given in ms.

returns.description: True if the key was pressed down within the given duration.

functions.name: upDuration
functions.description: Returns `true` if the Key was pressed down within the `duration` value given, or `false` if it either isn't down,or was pressed down longer ago than then given duration.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration within which the key is considered as being just released. Given in ms.

returns.description: True if the key was released within the given duration.

functions.name: justPressed
functions.description: Returns `true` if the Key was just pressed down this update tick, or `false` if it either isn't down,or was pressed down on a previous update tick.

returns.description: True if the key was just pressed down this update tick.

functions.name: justReleased
functions.description: Returns `true` if the Key was just released this update tick, or `false` if it either isn't up,or was released on a previous update tick.

returns.description: True if the key was just released this update tick.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: _enabled
members.description: The enabled state of the key - see `enabled`.

members.name: event
members.description: Stores the most recent DOM event.

members.name: isDown
members.description: The "down" state of the key. This will remain `true` for as long as the keyboard thinks this key is held down.

members.name: isUp
members.description: The "up" state of the key. This will remain `true` for as long as the keyboard thinks this key is up.

members.name: altKey
members.description: The down state of the ALT key, if pressed at the same time as this key.

members.name: ctrlKey
members.description: The down state of the CTRL key, if pressed at the same time as this key.

members.name: shiftKey
members.description: The down state of the SHIFT key, if pressed at the same time as this key.

members.name: timeDown
members.description: The timestamp when the key was last pressed down. This is based on Game.time.now.

members.name: duration
members.description: If the key is down this value holds the duration of that key press and is constantly updated.If the key is up it holds the duration of the previous down session. The number of milliseconds this key has been held down for.

members.name: timeUp
members.description: The timestamp when the key was last released. This is based on Game.time.now.

members.name: durationUp
members.description: If the key is up this value holds the duration of that key release and is constantly updated.If the key is down it holds the duration of the previous up session.

members.name: repeats
members.description: If a key is held down this holds down the number of times the key has 'repeated'.

members.name: keyCode
members.description: The keycode of this key.

members.name: onDown
members.description: This Signal is dispatched every time this Key is pressed down. It is only dispatched once (until the key is released again).

members.name: onHoldCallback
members.description: A callback that is called while this Key is held down. Warning: Depending on refresh rate that could be 60+ times per second.

members.name: onHoldContext
members.description: The context under which the onHoldCallback will be called.

members.name: onUp
members.description: This Signal is dispatched every time this Key is released. It is only dispatched once (until the key is pressed and released again).

members.name: _justDown
members.description: True if the key has just been pressed (NOTE: requires to be reset, see justDown getter)

members.name: _justUp
members.description: True if the key has just been pressed (NOTE: requires to be reset, see justDown getter)

members.name: justDown
members.description: The justDown value allows you to test if this Key has just been pressed down or not.When you check this value it will return `true` if the Key is down, otherwise `false`.You can only call justDown once per key press. It will only return `true` once, until the Key is released and pressed down again.This allows you to use it in situations where you want to check if this key is down without using a Signal, such as in a core game loop.

members.name: justUp
members.description: The justUp value allows you to test if this Key has just been released or not.When you check this value it will return `true` if the Key is up, otherwise `false`.You can only call justUp once per key release. It will only return `true` once, until the Key is pressed down and released again.This allows you to use it in situations where you want to check if this key is up without using a Signal, such as in a core game loop.

members.name: enabled
members.description: An enabled key processes its update and dispatches events.A key can be disabled momentarily at runtime instead of deleting it.

classes.name: Phaser.Keyboard
classes.description: The Keyboard class monitors keyboard input and dispatches keyboard events._Note_: many keyboards are unable to process certain combinations of keys due to hardware limitations known as ghosting.See http://www.html5gamedevs.com/topic/4876-impossible-to-use-more-than-2-keyboard-input-buttons-at-the-same-time/ for more details.Also please be aware that certain browser extensions can disable or override Phaser keyboard handling.For example the Chrome extension vimium is known to disable Phaser from using the D key. And there are others.So please check your extensions before opening Phaser issues.

constructor.name: Keyboard
constructor.description: The Keyboard class monitors keyboard input and dispatches keyboard events._Note_: many keyboards are unable to process certain combinations of keys due to hardware limitations known as ghosting.See http://www.html5gamedevs.com/topic/4876-impossible-to-use-more-than-2-keyboard-input-buttons-at-the-same-time/ for more details.Also please be aware that certain browser extensions can disable or override Phaser keyboard handling.For example the Chrome extension vimium is known to disable Phaser from using the D key. And there are others.So please check your extensions before opening Phaser issues.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: addCallbacks
functions.description: Add callbacks to the Keyboard handler so that each time a key is pressed down or released the callbacks are activated.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context under which the callbacks are run.

parameters.name: onDown
parameters.description: This callback is invoked every time a key is pressed down.

parameters.name: onUp
parameters.description: This callback is invoked every time a key is released.

parameters.name: onPress
parameters.description: This callback is invoked every time the onkeypress event is raised.

functions.name: addKey
functions.description: If you need more fine-grained control over a Key you can create a new Phaser.Key object via this method.The Key object can then be polled, have events attached to it, etc.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The {@link Phaser.KeyCode keycode} of the key.

returns.description: The Key object which you can store locally and reference directly.

functions.name: addKeys
functions.description: A practical way to create an object containing user selected hotkeys.For example,    addKeys( { 'up': Phaser.KeyCode.W, 'down': Phaser.KeyCode.S, 'left': Phaser.KeyCode.A, 'right': Phaser.KeyCode.D } );would return an object containing properties (`up`, `down`, `left` and `right`) referring to {@link Phaser.Key} object.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A key mapping object, i.e. `{ 'up': Phaser.KeyCode.W, 'down': Phaser.KeyCode.S }` or `{ 'up': 52, 'down': 53 }`.

returns.description: An object containing the properties mapped to {@link Phaser.Key} values.

functions.name: removeKey
functions.description: Removes a Key object from the Keyboard manager.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The {@link Phaser.KeyCode keycode} of the key to remove.

functions.name: createCursorKeys
functions.description: Creates and returns an object containing 4 hotkeys for Up, Down, Left and Right.

returns.description: An object containing properties: `up`, `down`, `left` and `right` of {@link Phaser.Key} objects.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the Keyboard event listeners running (keydown and keyup). They are attached to the window.This is called automatically by Phaser.Input and should not normally be invoked directly.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops the Keyboard event listeners from running (keydown, keyup and keypress). They are removed from the window.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Stops the Keyboard event listeners from running (keydown and keyup). They are removed from the window.Also clears all key captures and currently created Key objects.

functions.name: addKeyCapture
functions.description: By default when a key is pressed Phaser will not stop the event from propagating up to the browser.There are some keys this can be annoying for, like the arrow keys or space bar, which make the browser window scroll.The `addKeyCapture` method enables consuming keyboard event for specific keys so it doesn't bubble up to the the browserand cause the default browser behavior.Pass in either a single keycode or an array/hash of keycodes.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: Either a single {@link Phaser.KeyCode keycode} or an array/hash of keycodes such as `[65, 67, 68]`.

functions.name: removeKeyCapture
functions.description: Removes an existing key capture.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The {@link Phaser.KeyCode keycode} to remove capturing of.

functions.name: clearCaptures
functions.description: Clear all set key captures.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates all currently defined keys.

functions.name: processKeyDown
functions.description: Process the keydown event.

functions.name: processKeyPress
functions.description: Process the keypress event.

functions.name: processKeyUp
functions.description: Process the keyup event.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets all Keys.

parameters.name: hard
parameters.description: A soft reset won't reset any events or callbacks that are bound to the Keys. A hard reset will.

functions.name: downDuration
functions.description: Returns `true` if the Key was pressed down within the `duration` value given, or `false` if it either isn't down,or was pressed down longer ago than then given duration.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The {@link Phaser.KeyCode keycode} of the key to check: i.e. Phaser.KeyCode.UP or Phaser.KeyCode.SPACEBAR.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration within which the key is considered as being just pressed. Given in ms.

returns.description: True if the key was pressed down within the given duration, false if not or null if the Key wasn't found.

functions.name: upDuration
functions.description: Returns `true` if the Key was pressed down within the `duration` value given, or `false` if it either isn't down,or was pressed down longer ago than then given duration.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The keycode of the key to check, i.e. Phaser.KeyCode.UP or Phaser.KeyCode.SPACEBAR.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration within which the key is considered as being just released. Given in ms.

returns.description: True if the key was released within the given duration, false if not or null if the Key wasn't found.

functions.name: isDown
functions.description: Returns true of the key is currently pressed down. Note that it can only detect key presses on the web browser.

parameters.name: keycode
parameters.description: The {@link Phaser.KeyCode keycode} of the key to check: i.e. Phaser.KeyCode.UP or Phaser.KeyCode.SPACEBAR.

returns.description: True if the key is currently down, false if not or null if the Key wasn't found.

classes.name: Phaser.KeyCode
classes.description: A key code represents a physical key on a keyboard.The KeyCode class contains commonly supported keyboard key codes which can be usedas keycode`-parameters in several {@link Phaser.Keyboard} and {@link Phaser.Key} methods._Note_: These values should only be used indirectly, eg. as `Phaser.KeyCode.KEY`.Future versions may replace the actual values, such that they remain compatible with `keycode`-parameters.The current implementation maps to the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyCode KeyboardEvent.keyCode} property._Note_: Use `Phaser.KeyCode.KEY` instead of `Phaser.Keyboard.KEY` to refer to a key code;the latter approach is supported for compatibility.

constructor.name: KeyCode
constructor.description: A key code represents a physical key on a keyboard.The KeyCode class contains commonly supported keyboard key codes which can be usedas keycode`-parameters in several {@link Phaser.Keyboard} and {@link Phaser.Key} methods._Note_: These values should only be used indirectly, eg. as `Phaser.KeyCode.KEY`.Future versions may replace the actual values, such that they remain compatible with `keycode`-parameters.The current implementation maps to the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyCode KeyboardEvent.keyCode} property._Note_: Use `Phaser.KeyCode.KEY` instead of `Phaser.Keyboard.KEY` to refer to a key code;the latter approach is supported for compatibility.

classes.name: Phaser.Mouse
classes.description: The Mouse class is responsible for handling all aspects of mouse interaction with the browser.It captures and processes mouse events that happen on the game canvas object.It also adds a single `mouseup` listener to `window` which is used to capture the mouse being releasedwhen not over the game.You should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer objectwhich normalises all game input for you, including accurate button handling.

constructor.name: Mouse
constructor.description: The Mouse class is responsible for handling all aspects of mouse interaction with the browser.It captures and processes mouse events that happen on the game canvas object.It also adds a single `mouseup` listener to `window` which is used to capture the mouse being releasedwhen not over the game.You should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer objectwhich normalises all game input for you, including accurate button handling.

classes.name: Phaser.MSPointer
classes.description: The MSPointer class handles Microsoft touch interactions with the game and the resulting Pointer objects.It will work only in Internet Explorer 10+ and Windows Store or Windows Phone 8 apps using JavaScript.http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/hh673557(v=vs.85).aspxYou should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer object which normalises all game input for you including accurate button handling.Please note that at the current time of writing Phaser does not yet support chorded button interactions:http://www.w3.org/TR/pointerevents/#chorded-button-interactions

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Called when the Pointer leaves the touchscreen.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event passed up from the input handler.

functions.name: justPressed
functions.description: The Pointer is considered justPressed if the time it was pressed onto the touchscreen or clicked is less than justPressedRate.Note that calling justPressed doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.If you wish to check if the Pointer was pressed down just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputDown event.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justPressedRate.

returns.description: true if the Pointer was pressed down within the duration given.

functions.name: justReleased
functions.description: The Pointer is considered justReleased if the time it left the touchscreen is less than justReleasedRate.Note that calling justReleased doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.If you wish to check if the Pointer was released just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputUp event.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justReleasedRate.

returns.description: true if the Pointer was released within the duration given.

functions.name: addClickTrampoline
functions.description: Add a click trampoline to this pointer.A click trampoline is a callback that is run on the DOM 'click' event; this is primarilyneeded with certain browsers (ie. IE11) which restrict some actions like requestFullscreento the DOM 'click' event and rejects it for 'pointer*' and 'mouse*' events.This is used internally by the ScaleManager; click trampoline usage is uncommon.Click trampolines can only be added to pointers that are currently down.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the trampoline; must be unique among active trampolines in this pointer.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback to run/trampoline.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: Context of the callback.

parameters.name: callbackArgs
parameters.description: Additional callback args, if any. Supplied as an array.

functions.name: processClickTrampolines
functions.description: Fire all click trampolines for which the pointers are still referring to the registered object.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the Pointer properties. Called by InputManager.reset when you perform a State change.

functions.name: resetMovement
functions.description: Resets the movementX and movementY properties. Use in your update handler after retrieving the values.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: id
members.description: The ID of the Pointer object within the game. Each game can have up to 10 active pointers.

members.name: type
members.description: The const type of this object.

members.name: exists
members.description: A Pointer object that exists is allowed to be checked for physics collisions and overlaps.

members.name: identifier
members.description: The identifier property of the Pointer as set by the DOM event when this Pointer is started.

members.name: pointerId
members.description: The pointerId property of the Pointer as set by the DOM event when this Pointer is started. The browser can and will recycle this value.

members.name: pointerMode
members.description: The operational mode of this pointer.

members.name: target
members.description: The target property of the Pointer as set by the DOM event when this Pointer is started.

members.name: button
members.description: The button property of the most recent DOM event when this Pointer is started.You should not rely on this value for accurate button detection, instead use the Pointer properties`leftButton`, `rightButton`, `middleButton` and so on.

members.name: leftButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its left button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.

members.name: middleButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its middle button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: rightButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its right button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: backButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its X1 (back) button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: forwardButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its X2 (forward) button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: eraserButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Pen / Stylus then you can access its eraser button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: _holdSent
members.description: Local private variable to store the status of dispatching a hold event.

members.name: _history
members.description: Local private variable storing the short-term history of pointer movements.

members.name: _nextDrop
members.description: Local private variable storing the time at which the next history drop should occur.

members.name: _stateReset
members.description: Monitor events outside of a state reset loop.

members.name: withinGame
members.description: true if the Pointer is over the game canvas, otherwise false.

members.name: clientX
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer within the application's client area at which the event occurred (as opposed to the coordinates within the page).

members.name: clientY
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer within the application's client area at which the event occurred (as opposed to the coordinates within the page).

members.name: pageX
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer relative to whole document.

members.name: pageY
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer relative to whole document.

members.name: screenX
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer relative to the screen.

members.name: screenY
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer relative to the screen.

members.name: rawMovementX
members.description: The horizontal raw relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: rawMovementY
members.description: The vertical raw relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: movementX
members.description: The horizontal processed relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: movementY
members.description: The vertical processed relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: x
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer. This value is automatically scaled based on the game scale.

members.name: y
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer. This value is automatically scaled based on the game scale.

members.name: isMouse
members.description: If the Pointer is a mouse or pen / stylus this is true, otherwise false.

members.name: isDown
members.description: If the Pointer is touching the touchscreen, or *any* mouse or pen button is held down, isDown is set to true.If you need to check a specific mouse or pen button then use the button properties, i.e. Pointer.rightButton.isDown.

members.name: isUp
members.description: If the Pointer is not touching the touchscreen, or *all* mouse or pen buttons are up, isUp is set to true.If you need to check a specific mouse or pen button then use the button properties, i.e. Pointer.rightButton.isUp.

members.name: timeDown
members.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer first touched the touchscreen.

members.name: timeUp
members.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer left the touchscreen.

members.name: previousTapTime
members.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer was last tapped or clicked.

members.name: totalTouches
members.description: The total number of times this Pointer has been touched to the touchscreen.

members.name: msSinceLastClick
members.description: The number of milliseconds since the last click or touch event.

members.name: targetObject
members.description: The Game Object this Pointer is currently over / touching / dragging.

members.name: interactiveCandidates
members.description: This array is erased and re-populated every time this Pointer is updated. It contains references to allof the Game Objects that were considered as being valid for processing by this Pointer, this frame. To bevalid they must have suitable a `priorityID`, be Input enabled, visible and actually have the Pointer overthem. You can check the contents of this array in events such as `onInputDown`, but beware it is resetevery frame.

members.name: active
members.description: An active pointer is one that is currently pressed down on the display. A Mouse is always active.

members.name: dirty
members.description: A dirty pointer needs to re-poll any interactive objects it may have been over, regardless if it has moved or not.

members.name: position
members.description: A Phaser.Point object containing the current x/y values of the pointer on the display.

members.name: positionDown
members.description: A Phaser.Point object containing the x/y values of the pointer when it was last in a down state on the display.

members.name: positionUp
members.description: A Phaser.Point object containing the x/y values of the pointer when it was last released.

members.name: circle
members.description: A Phaser.Circle that is centered on the x/y coordinates of this pointer, useful for hit detection.The Circle size is 44px (Apples recommended "finger tip" size).

members.name: _clickTrampolines
members.description: Click trampolines associated with this pointer. See `addClickTrampoline`.

members.name: _trampolineTargetObject
members.description: When the Pointer has click trampolines the last target object is stored hereso it can be used to check for validity of the trampoline in a post-Up/'stop'.

members.name: NO_BUTTON
members.description: No buttons at all.

members.name: LEFT_BUTTON
members.description: The Left Mouse button, or in PointerEvent devices a Touch contact or Pen contact.

members.name: RIGHT_BUTTON
members.description: The Right Mouse button, or in PointerEvent devices a Pen contact with a barrel button.

members.name: MIDDLE_BUTTON
members.description: The Middle Mouse button.

members.name: BACK_BUTTON
members.description: The X1 button. This is typically the mouse Back button, but is often reconfigured.On Linux (GTK) this is unsupported. On Windows if advanced pointer software (such as IntelliPoint) is installed this doesn't register.

members.name: FORWARD_BUTTON
members.description: The X2 button. This is typically the mouse Forward button, but is often reconfigured.On Linux (GTK) this is unsupported. On Windows if advanced pointer software (such as IntelliPoint) is installed this doesn't register.

members.name: ERASER_BUTTON
members.description: The Eraser pen button on PointerEvent supported devices only.

members.name: duration
members.description: How long the Pointer has been depressed on the touchscreen or *any* of the mouse buttons have been held down.If not currently down it returns -1.If you need to test a specific mouse or pen button then access the buttons directly, i.e. `Pointer.rightButton.duration`.

members.name: worldX
members.description: Gets the X value of this Pointer in world coordinates based on the world camera.

members.name: worldY
members.description: Gets the Y value of this Pointer in world coordinates based on the world camera.

classes.name: Phaser.PointerMode
classes.description: Enumeration categorizing operational modes of pointers.PointerType values represent valid bitmasks.For example, a value representing both Mouse and Touch devicescan be expressed as `PointerMode.CURSOR | PointerMode.CONTACT`.Values may be added for future mode categorizations.

constructor.name: PointerMode
constructor.description: Enumeration categorizing operational modes of pointers.PointerType values represent valid bitmasks.For example, a value representing both Mouse and Touch devicescan be expressed as `PointerMode.CURSOR | PointerMode.CONTACT`.Values may be added for future mode categorizations.

members.name: CURSOR
members.description: A 'CURSOR' is a pointer with a *passive cursor* such as a mouse, touchpad, watcom stylus, or even TV-control arrow-pad.It has the property that a cursor is passively moved without activating the input.This currently corresponds with {@link Phaser.Pointer#isMouse} property.

members.name: CONTACT
members.description: A 'CONTACT' pointer has an *active cursor* that only tracks movement when actived; notably this is a touch-style input.

classes.name: Phaser.Touch
classes.description: Phaser.Touch handles touch events with your game. Note: Android 2.x only supports 1 touch event at once, no multi-touch.You should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer object which normalises all game input for you.

constructor.name: Touch
constructor.description: Phaser.Touch handles touch events with your game. Note: Android 2.x only supports 1 touch event at once, no multi-touch.You should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer object which normalises all game input for you.

parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: addTouchLockCallback
functions.description: Adds a callback that is fired when a browser touchstart or touchend event is received.This is used internally to handle audio and video unlocking on mobile devices.If the callback returns 'true' then the callback is automatically deleted once invoked.The callback is added to the Phaser.Touch.touchLockCallbacks array and should be removed with Phaser.Touch.removeTouchLockCallback.

parameters.description: Will the callback fire on a touchstart (default) or touchend event?

parameters.description: The callback to be removed.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback exists.

returns.description: True if the callback was deleted, otherwise false.

classes.name: Phaser.Cache
classes.description: Phaser has one single cache in which it stores all assets.The cache is split up into sections, such as images, sounds, video, json, etc. All assets are stored usinga unique string-based key as their identifier. Assets stored in different areas of the cache can have thesame key, for example 'playerWalking' could be used as the key for both a sprite sheet and an audio file,because they are unique data types.The cache is automatically populated by the Phaser.Loader. When you use the loader to pull in external assetssuch as images they are automatically placed into their respective cache. Most common Game Objects, such asSprites and Videos automatically query the cache to extract the assets they need on instantiation.You can access the cache from within a State via `this.cache`. From here you can call any public method it has,including adding new entries to it, deleting them or querying them.Understand that almost without exception when you get an item from the cache it will return a reference to theitem stored in the cache, not a copy of it. Therefore if you retrieve an item and then modify it, the originalobject in the cache will also be updated, even if you don't put it back into the cache again.By default when you change State the cache is _not_ cleared, although there is an option to clear it shouldyour game require it. In a typical game set-up the cache is populated once after the main game has loaded andthen used as an asset store.

constructor.name: Cache
constructor.description: Phaser has one single cache in which it stores all assets.The cache is split up into sections, such as images, sounds, video, json, etc. All assets are stored usinga unique string-based key as their identifier. Assets stored in different areas of the cache can have thesame key, for example 'playerWalking' could be used as the key for both a sprite sheet and an audio file,because they are unique data types.The cache is automatically populated by the Phaser.Loader. When you use the loader to pull in external assetssuch as images they are automatically placed into their respective cache. Most common Game Objects, such asSprites and Videos automatically query the cache to extract the assets they need on instantiation.You can access the cache from within a State via `this.cache`. From here you can call any public method it has,including adding new entries to it, deleting them or querying them.Understand that almost without exception when you get an item from the cache it will return a reference to theitem stored in the cache, not a copy of it. Therefore if you retrieve an item and then modify it, the originalobject in the cache will also be updated, even if you don't put it back into the cache again.By default when you change State the cache is _not_ cleared, although there is an option to clear it shouldyour game require it. In a typical game set-up the cache is populated once after the main game has loaded andthen used as an asset store.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: addCompressedTextureMetaData
functions.description: Add a new canvas object in to the cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

returns.description: The compressed texture entry.

functions.name: addCanvas
functions.description: Add a new canvas object in to the cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The Canvas DOM element.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context of the canvas element. If not specified it will default go `getContext('2d')`.

functions.name: addImage
functions.description: Adds an Image file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader, but can also have been loaded into the DOM.If an image already exists in the cache with the same key then it is removed and destroyed, and the new image inserted in its place.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Extra image data.

returns.description: The full image object that was added to the cache.

functions.name: addDefaultImage
functions.description: Adds a default image to be used in special cases such as WebGL Filters.It uses the special reserved key of `__default`.This method is called automatically when the Cache is created.This image is skipped when `Cache.destroy` is called due to its internal requirements.

functions.name: addMissingImage
functions.description: Adds an image to be used when a key is wrong / missing.It uses the special reserved key of `__missing`.This method is called automatically when the Cache is created.This image is skipped when `Cache.destroy` is called due to its internal requirements.

functions.name: addSound
functions.description: Adds a Sound file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Extra sound data.

parameters.name: webAudio
parameters.description: True if the file is using web audio.

parameters.name: audioTag
parameters.description: True if the file is using legacy HTML audio.

functions.name: addText
functions.description: Add a new text data.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Extra text data.

functions.name: addPhysicsData
functions.description: Add a new physics data object to the Cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url

parameters.name: bitmapData

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.description: Optional FrameData set associated with the given BitmapData. If not specified (or `undefined`) a new FrameData object is created containing the Bitmap's Frame. If `null` is supplied then no FrameData will be created.

functions.name: addBitmapFont
functions.description: Add a new Bitmap Font to the Cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Extra font data.

parameters.name: atlasData
parameters.description: The Bitmap Font data.

parameters.name: atlasType
parameters.description: The format of the Bitmap Font data file: `json` or `xml`.

parameters.name: xSpacing
parameters.description: If you'd like to add additional horizontal spacing between the characters then set the pixel value here.

parameters.name: ySpacing
parameters.description: If you'd like to add additional vertical spacing between the lines then set the pixel value here.

functions.name: addBitmapFontFromAtlas
functions.description: Add a new Bitmap Font to the Cache, where the font texture is part of a Texture Atlas.The atlas must already exist in the cache, and be available based on the given `atlasKey`.The `atlasFrame` specifies the name of the frame within the atlas that the Bitmap Font isstored in.The `dataKey` is the key of the XML or JSON Bitmap Font Data, which must already be inthe Cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: atlasKey
parameters.description: The key of the Texture Atlas in the Cache.

parameters.name: atlasFrame
parameters.description: The frame of the Texture Atlas that the Bitmap Font is in.

parameters.name: dataKey
parameters.description: The key of the Bitmap Font data in the Cache

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description: The format of the Bitmap Font data: `json` or `xml`.

parameters.name: xSpacing
parameters.description: If you'd like to add additional horizontal spacing between the characters then set the pixel value here.

parameters.name: ySpacing
parameters.description: If you'd like to add additional vertical spacing between the lines then set the pixel value here.

functions.name: checkURL
functions.description: Checks if the given URL has been loaded into the Cache.This method will only work if Cache.autoResolveURL was set to `true` before any preloading took place.The method will make a DOM src call to the URL given, so please be aware of this for certain file types, such as Sound files on Firefoxwhich may cause double-load instances.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url to check for in the cache.

returns.description: True if the url exists, otherwise false.
