functions.name: getItem
functions.description: Get an item from a cache based on the given key and property.This method is mostly used internally by other Cache methods such as `getImage` but is exposedpublicly for your own use as well.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset within the cache.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The string name of the method calling getItem. Can be empty, in which case no console warning is output.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: If you require a specific property from the cache item, specify it here.

returns.description: The cached item if found, otherwise `null`. If the key is invalid and `method` is set then a console.warn is output.

functions.name: getCanvas
functions.description: Gets a Canvas object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The canvas object or `null` if no item could be found matching the given key.

functions.name: getImage
functions.description: Gets a Image object from the cache. This returns a DOM Image object, not a Phaser.Image object.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.Only the Image cache is searched, which covers images loaded via Loader.image, Sprite Sheets and Texture Atlases.If you need the image used by a bitmap font or similar then please use those respective 'get' methods.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache. If not given or null it will return a default image. If given but not found in the cache it will throw a warning and return the missing image.

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: If true the full image object will be returned, if false just the HTML Image object is returned.

returns.description: The Image object if found in the Cache, otherwise `null`. If `full` was true then a JavaScript object is returned.

functions.name: getTextureFrame
functions.description: Get a single texture frame by key.You'd only do this to get the default Frame created for a non-atlas / spritesheet image.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The frame data.

functions.name: getSound
functions.description: Gets a Phaser.Sound object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The sound object.

functions.name: getSoundData
functions.description: Gets a raw Sound data object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The sound data.

functions.name: getText
functions.description: Gets a Text object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The text data.

functions.name: getPhysicsData
functions.description: Gets a Physics Data object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.You can get either the entire data set, a single object or a single fixture of an object from it.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: If specified it will return just the physics object that is part of the given key, if null it will return them all.

parameters.name: fixtureKey
parameters.description: Fixture key of fixture inside an object. This key can be set per fixture with the Phaser Exporter.

returns.description: The requested physics object data if found.

functions.name: getTilemapData
functions.description: Gets a raw Tilemap data object from the cache. This will be in either CSV or JSON format.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The raw tilemap data in CSV or JSON format.

functions.name: getBinary
functions.description: Gets a binary object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The binary data object.

functions.name: getBitmapData
functions.description: Gets a BitmapData object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The requested BitmapData object if found, or null if not.

functions.name: getBitmapFont
functions.description: Gets a Bitmap Font object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The requested BitmapFont object if found, or null if not.

functions.name: getJSON
functions.description: Gets a JSON object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.You can either return the object by reference (the default), or return a cloneof it by setting the `clone` argument to `true`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

parameters.name: clone
parameters.description: Return a clone of the original object (true) or a reference to it? (false)

returns.description: The JSON object, or an Array if the key points to an Array property. If the property wasn't found, it returns null.

functions.name: getXML
functions.description: Gets an XML object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The XML object.

functions.name: getVideo
functions.description: Gets a Phaser.Video object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The video object.

functions.name: getShader
functions.description: Gets a fragment shader object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The shader object.

functions.name: getRenderTexture
functions.description: Gets a RenderTexture object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The object with Phaser.RenderTexture and Phaser.Frame.

functions.name: getBaseTexture

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Asset key of the image for which you want the BaseTexture for.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search for the item in.

returns.description: The BaseTexture object.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search for the item in.

returns.description: The frame data.

parameters.name: cache

returns.description: Then number of frames. 0 if the image is not found.

functions.name: getFrameData

parameters.name: key

parameters.name: cache

returns.description: The frame data.

functions.description: Check if the FrameData for the given key exists in the Image Cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search for the item in.

returns.description: True if the given key has frameData in the cache, otherwise false.

functions.description: Replaces a set of frameData with a new Phaser.FrameData object.

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Get a cached object by the URL.This only returns a value if you set Cache.autoResolveURL to `true` *before* starting the preload of any assets.Be aware that every call to this function makes a DOM src query, so use carefully and double-check for implications in your target browsers/devices.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url for the object loaded to get from the cache.

returns.description: The cached object.

functions.name: getKeys
functions.description: Gets all keys used in the requested Cache.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The Cache you wish to get the keys from. Can be any of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE`, `Phaser.Cache.SOUND` etc.

returns.description: The array of keys in the requested cache.

functions.name: removeCanvas
functions.description: Removes a canvas from the cache.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

functions.name: removeImage
functions.description: Removes an image from the cache.You can optionally elect to destroy it as well. This calls BaseTexture.destroy on it.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

parameters.name: destroyBaseTexture
parameters.description: Should the BaseTexture behind this image also be destroyed?

functions.name: removeSound
functions.description: Removes a sound from the cache.If any `Phaser.Sound` objects use the audio file in the cache that you remove with this method, they will_automatically_ destroy themselves. If you wish to have full control over when Sounds are destroyed thenyou must finish your house-keeping and destroy them all yourself first, before calling this method.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

functions.name: removeTextureAtlas
functions.description: Removes a Texture Atlas from the cache.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

functions.name: clearGLTextures
functions.description: Empties out all of the GL Textures from Images stored in the cache.This is called automatically when the WebGL context is lost and then restored.

functions.name: _resolveURL
functions.description: Resolves a URL to its absolute form and stores it in Cache._urlMap as long as Cache.autoResolveURL is set to `true`.This is then looked-up by the Cache.getURL and Cache.checkURL calls.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to resolve. This is appended to Loader.baseURL.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data associated with the URL to be stored to the URL Map.

returns.description: The resolved URL.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Clears the cache. Removes every local cache object reference.If an object in the cache has a `destroy` method it will also be called.

classes.name: Phaser.Loader
classes.description: The Loader handles loading all external content such as Images, Sounds, Texture Atlases and data files.The loader uses a combination of tag loading (eg. Image elements) and XHR and provides progress and completion callbacks.Parallel loading (see {@link Phaser.Loader#enableParallel enableParallel}) is supported and enabled by default.Load-before behavior of parallel resources is controlled by synchronization points as discussed in {@link Phaser.Loader#withSyncPoint withSyncPoint}.Texture Atlases can be created with tools such as [Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker/phaser) and[Shoebox](http://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)

constructor.name: Loader
constructor.description: The Loader handles loading all external content such as Images, Sounds, Texture Atlases and data files.The loader uses a combination of tag loading (eg. Image elements) and XHR and provides progress and completion callbacks.Parallel loading (see {@link Phaser.Loader#enableParallel enableParallel}) is supported and enabled by default.Load-before behavior of parallel resources is controlled by synchronization points as discussed in {@link Phaser.Loader#withSyncPoint withSyncPoint}.Texture Atlases can be created with tools such as [Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker/phaser) and[Shoebox](http://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: setPreloadSprite
functions.description: Set a Sprite to be a "preload" sprite by passing it to this method.A "preload" sprite will have its width or height crop adjusted based on the percentage of the loader in real-time.This allows you to easily make loading bars for games.The sprite will automatically be made visible when calling this.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: The sprite or image that will be cropped during the load.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: A value of zero means the sprite will be cropped horizontally, a value of 1 means its will be cropped vertically.

functions.name: resize
functions.description: Called automatically by ScaleManager when the game resizes in RESIZE scalemode.This can be used to adjust the preloading sprite size, eg.

functions.name: checkKeyExists
functions.description: Check whether a file/asset with a specific key is queued to be loaded.To access a loaded asset use Phaser.Cache, eg. {@link Phaser.Cache#checkImageKey}

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type asset you want to check.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to check.

returns.description: Return true if exists, otherwise return false.

functions.name: getAssetIndex
functions.description: Get the queue-index of the file/asset with a specific key.Only assets in the download file queue will be found.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type asset you want to check.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to check.

returns.description: The index of this key in the filelist, or -1 if not found.    The index may change and should only be used immediately following this call

functions.name: getAsset
functions.description: Find a file/asset with a specific key.Only assets in the download file queue will be found.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type asset you want to check.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to check.

returns.description: Returns an object if found that has 2 properties: `index` and `file`; otherwise a non-true value is returned.    The index may change and should only be used immediately following this call.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Reset the loader and clear any queued assets. If `Loader.resetLocked` is true this operation will abort.This will abort any loading and clear any queued assets.Optionally you can clear any associated events.

parameters.name: hard
parameters.description: If true then the preload sprite and other artifacts may also be cleared.

parameters.name: clearEvents
parameters.description: If true then the all Loader signals will have removeAll called on them.

functions.name: addToFileList
functions.description: Internal function that adds a new entry to the file list. Do not call directly.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of resource to add to the list (image, audio, xml, etc).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The unique Cache ID key of this resource.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset will be loaded from.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Any additional properties needed to load the file. These are added directly to the added file object and overwrite any defaults.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If true then this will overwrite a file asset of the same type/key. Otherwise it will only add a new asset. If overwrite is true, and the asset is already being loaded (or has been loaded), then it is appended instead.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: If no URL is given the Loader will sometimes auto-generate the URL based on the key, using this as the extension.

returns.description: This instance of the Phaser Loader.

functions.name: replaceInFileList
functions.description: Internal function that replaces an existing entry in the file list with a new one. Do not call directly.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of resource to add to the list (image, audio, xml, etc).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The unique Cache ID key of this resource.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset will be loaded from.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Any additional properties needed to load the file.

functions.name: pack
functions.description: Add a JSON resource pack ('packfile') to the Loader.A packfile is a JSON file that contains a list of assets to the be loaded.Please see the example 'loader/asset pack' in the Phaser Examples repository.Packs are always put before the first non-pack file that is not loaded / loading.This means that all packs added before any loading has started are added to the frontof the file queue, in the order added.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.The URL of the packfile can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of this resource pack.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the Asset Pack JSON file. If you wish to pass a json object instead set this to null and pass the object as the data parameter.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The Asset Pack JSON data. Use this to pass in a json data object rather than loading it from a URL. TODO

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: Some Loader operations, like Binary and Script require a context for their callbacks. Pass the context here.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: image
functions.description: Adds an Image to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.Phaser can load all common image types: png, jpg, gif and any other format the browser can natively handle.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the image via `Cache.getImage(key)`The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.png". It will always add `.png` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.This method also supports passing in a texture object as the `url` argument. This allows you to loadcompressed textures into Phaser. You can also use `Loader.texture` to do this.Compressed Textures are a WebGL only feature, and require 3rd party tools to create.Available tools include Texture Packer, PVRTexTool, DirectX Texture Tool and Mali Texture Compression Tool.Supported texture compression formats are: PVRTC, S3TC and ETC1.Supported file formats are: PVR, DDS, KTX and PKM.The formats that support all 3 compression algorithms are PVR and KTX.PKM only supports ETC1, and DDS only S3TC for now.The texture path object looks like this:```load.image('factory', {    etc1: 'assets/factory_etc1.pkm',    s3tc: 'assets/factory_dxt1.pvr',    pvrtc: 'assets/factory_pvrtc.pvr',    truecolor: 'assets/factory.png'});```The `truecolor` property points to a standard PNG file, that will be used if none of the compressed formats are supported by the browser / GPU.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of this image file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of an image file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png". Can also be a texture data object.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If an unloaded file with a matching key already exists in the queue, this entry will overwrite it.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: texture
functions.description: Adds a Compressed Texture Image to the current load queue.Compressed Textures are a WebGL only feature, and require 3rd party tools to create.Available tools include Texture Packer, PVRTexTool, DirectX Texture Tool and Mali Texture Compression Tool.Supported texture compression formats are: PVRTC, S3TC and ETC1.Supported file formats are: PVR, DDS, KTX and PKM.The formats that support all 3 compression algorithms are PVR and KTX.PKM only supports ETC1, and DDS only S3TC for now.The texture path object looks like this:```load.texture('factory', {    etc1: 'assets/factory_etc1.pkm',    s3tc: 'assets/factory_dxt1.pvr',    pvrtc: 'assets/factory_pvrtc.pvr',    truecolor: 'assets/factory.png'});```The `truecolor` property points to a standard PNG file, that will be used if none of the compressed formats are supported by the browser / GPU.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the image via `Cache.getImage(key)`The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.pvr". It will always add `.pvr` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of this image file.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The texture path data object.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If an unloaded file with a matching key already exists in the queue, this entry will overwrite it.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: images
functions.description: Adds an array of images to the current load queue.It works by passing each element of the array to the Loader.image method.The files are **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The files are added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.Phaser can load all common image types: png, jpg, gif and any other format the browser can natively handle.The keys must be unique Strings. They are used to add the files to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the images via `Cache.getImage(key)`The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.png". It will always add `.png` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: An array of unique asset keys of the image files.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: Optional array of URLs. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png". If provided the URLs array length must match the keys array length.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: text
functions.description: Adds a Text file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getText(key)`The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.txt". It will always add `.txt` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the text file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the text file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.txt`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.txt".

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If an unloaded file with a matching key already exists in the queue, this entry will overwrite it.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: json
functions.description: Adds a JSON file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getJSON(key)`. JSON files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the JSON is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the text file as needed.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.json". It will always add `.json` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the json file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the JSON file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.json".

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If an unloaded file with a matching key already exists in the queue, this entry will overwrite it.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: shader
functions.description: Adds a fragment shader file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getShader(key)`.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "blur"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "blur.frag". It will always add `.frag` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the fragment file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the fragment file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.frag`, i.e. if `key` was "blur" then the URL will be "blur.frag".

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If an unloaded file with a matching key already exists in the queue, this entry will overwrite it.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: xml
functions.description: Adds an XML file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getXML(key)`.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.xml". It will always add `.xml` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the xml file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the XML file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.xml`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.xml".

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If an unloaded file with a matching key already exists in the queue, this entry will overwrite it.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: script
functions.description: Adds a JavaScript file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.js". It will always add `.js` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.Upon successful load the JavaScript is automatically turned into a script tag and executed, so be careful what you load!A callback, which will be invoked as the script tag has been created, can also be specified.The callback must return relevant `data`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the script file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the JavaScript file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.js`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.js".

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional callback that will be called after the script tag has loaded, so you can perform additional processing.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context under which the callback will be applied. If not specified it will use the Phaser Loader as the context.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: binary
functions.description: Adds a binary file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getBinary(key)`.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.bin". It will always add `.bin` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.It will be loaded via xhr with a responseType of "arraybuffer". You can specify an optional callback to process the file after load.When the callback is called it will be passed 2 parameters: the key of the file and the file data.WARNING: If a callback is specified the data will be set to whatever it returns. Always return the data object, even if you didn't modify it.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the binary file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the binary file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.bin`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.bin".

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional callback that will be passed the file after loading, so you can perform additional processing on it.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context under which the callback will be applied. If not specified it will use the callback itself as the context.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: spritesheet
functions.description: Adds a Sprite Sheet to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.To clarify the terminology that Phaser uses: A Sprite Sheet is an image containing frames, usually of an animation, that are all equaldimensions and often in sequence. For example if the frame size is 32x32 then every frame in the sprite sheet will be that size.Sometimes (outside of Phaser) the term "sprite sheet" is used to refer to a texture atlas.A Texture Atlas works by packing together images as best it can, using whatever frame sizes it likes, often with cropping and trimmingthe frames in the process. Software such as Texture Packer, Flash CC or Shoebox all generate texture atlases, not sprite sheets.If you've got an atlas then use `Loader.atlas` instead.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the image to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getImage(key)`. Sprite sheets, being image based, live in the same Cache as all other Images.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that. For example if the key is "alien"and no URL is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.png". It will always add `.png` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the sheet file.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the sprite sheet file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png".

parameters.name: frameWidth
parameters.description: Width in pixels of a single frame in the sprite sheet.

parameters.name: frameHeight
parameters.description: Height in pixels of a single frame in the sprite sheet.

parameters.name: frameMax
parameters.description: How many frames in this sprite sheet. If not specified it will divide the whole image into frames.

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: If the frames have been drawn with a margin, specify the amount here.

parameters.name: spacing
parameters.description: If the frames have been drawn with spacing between them, specify the amount here.

parameters.name: skipFrames
parameters.description: Skip a number of frames. Useful when there are multiple sprite sheets in one image.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: audio
functions.description: Adds an audio file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getSound(key)`.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.Mobile warning: There are some mobile devices (certain iPad 2 and iPad Mini revisions) that cannot play 48000 Hz audio.When they try to play the audio becomes extremely distorted and buzzes, eventually crashing the sound system.The solution is to use a lower encoding rate such as 44100 Hz.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the audio file.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: Either a single string or an array of URIs or pairs of `{uri: .., type: ..}`.   If an array is specified then the first URI (or URI + mime pair) that is device-compatible will be selected.   For example: `"jump.mp3"`, `['jump.mp3', 'jump.ogg', 'jump.m4a']`, or `[{uri: "data:<opus_resource>", type: 'opus'}, 'fallback.mp3']`.   BLOB and DATA URIs can be used but only support automatic detection when used in the pair form; otherwise the format must be manually checked before adding the resource.

parameters.name: autoDecode
parameters.description: When using Web Audio the audio files can either be decoded at load time or run-time.   Audio files can't be played until they are decoded and, if specified, this enables immediate decoding. Decoding is a non-blocking async process, however it consumes huge amounts of CPU time on mobiles especially.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: audioSprite
functions.description: Adds an audio sprite file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Audio Sprites are a combination of audio files and a JSON configuration.The JSON follows the format of that created by https://github.com/tonistiigi/audiospriteRetrieve the file via `Cache.getSoundData(key)`.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the audio file.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: An array containing the URLs of the audio files, i.e.: [ 'audiosprite.mp3', 'audiosprite.ogg', 'audiosprite.m4a' ] or a single string containing just one URL.

parameters.name: jsonURL
parameters.description: The URL of the audiosprite configuration JSON object. If you wish to pass the data directly set this parameter to null.

parameters.name: jsonData
parameters.description: A JSON object or string containing the audiosprite configuration data. This is ignored if jsonURL is not null.

parameters.name: autoDecode
parameters.description: When using Web Audio the audio files can either be decoded at load time or run-time.   Audio files can't be played until they are decoded and, if specified, this enables immediate decoding. Decoding is a non-blocking async process, however it consumes huge amounts of CPU time on mobiles especially.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: audiosprite
functions.description: A legacy alias for Loader.audioSprite. Please see that method for documentation.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the audio file.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: An array containing the URLs of the audio files, i.e.: [ 'audiosprite.mp3', 'audiosprite.ogg', 'audiosprite.m4a' ] or a single string containing just one URL.

parameters.name: jsonURL
parameters.description: The URL of the audiosprite configuration JSON object. If you wish to pass the data directly set this parameter to null.

parameters.name: jsonData
parameters.description: A JSON object or string containing the audiosprite configuration data. This is ignored if jsonURL is not null.

parameters.name: autoDecode
parameters.description: When using Web Audio the audio files can either be decoded at load time or run-time.   Audio files can't be played until they are decoded and, if specified, this enables immediate decoding. Decoding is a non-blocking async process, however it consumes huge amounts of CPU time on mobiles especially.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: video
functions.description: Adds a video file to the current load queue.The file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method. The file is added to the queue ready to be loaded when the loader starts.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getVideo(key)`.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.You don't need to preload a video in order to play it in your game. See `Video.createVideoFromURL` for details.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the video file.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: Either a single string or an array of URIs or pairs of `{uri: .., type: ..}`.   If an array is specified then the first URI (or URI + mime pair) that is device-compatible will be selected.   For example: `"boom.mp4"`, `['boom.mp4', 'boom.ogg', 'boom.webm']`, or `[{uri: "data:<opus_resource>", type: 'opus'}, 'fallback.mp4']`.   BLOB and DATA URIs can be used but only support automatic detection when used in the pair form; otherwise the format must be manually checked before adding the resource.

parameters.name: loadEvent
parameters.description: This sets the Video source event to listen for before the load is considered complete.   'canplaythrough' implies the video has downloaded enough, and bandwidth is high enough that it can be played to completion.   'canplay' implies the video has downloaded enough to start playing, but not necessarily to finish.   'loadeddata' just makes sure that the video meta data and first frame have downloaded. Phaser uses this value automatically if the   browser is detected as being Firefox and no `loadEvent` is given, otherwise it defaults to `canplaythrough`.

parameters.name: asBlob
parameters.description: Video files can either be loaded via the creation of a video element which has its src property set.   Or they can be loaded via xhr, stored as binary data in memory and then converted to a Blob. This isn't supported in IE9 or Android 2.   If you need to have the same video playing at different times across multiple Sprites then you need to load it as a Blob.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: tilemap
functions.description: Adds a Tile Map data file to the current load queue.Phaser can load data in two different formats: CSV and Tiled JSON.Tiled is a free software package, specifically for creating tilemaps, and is available from http://www.mapeditor.orgYou can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to a json file.Or you can pass in a JSON object or String via the `data` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `JSON.parse` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If a URL is provided the file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but is added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getTilemapData(key)`. JSON files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the JSON is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the text file as needed.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified and no data is given then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "level1" and no URL or data is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "level1.json".If you set the format to be Tilemap.CSV it will set the URL to be "level1.csv" instead.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL or data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the tilemap data.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the tile map file. If undefined or `null` and no data is given the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "level1" then the URL will be "level1.json".

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: An optional JSON data object. If given then the url is ignored and this JSON object is used for map data instead.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the map data. Either Phaser.Tilemap.CSV or Phaser.Tilemap.TILED_JSON.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: physics
functions.description: Adds a physics data file to the current load queue.The data must be in `Lime + Corona` JSON format. [Physics Editor](https://www.codeandweb.com) by code'n'web exports in this format natively.You can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to a json file.Or you can pass in a JSON object or String via the `data` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `JSON.parse` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If a URL is provided the file is **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but is added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getJSON(key)`. JSON files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the JSON is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the text file as needed.The URL can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the URL isn't specified and no data is given then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "alien" and no URL or data is given then the Loader will set the URL to be "alien.json".It will always use `.json` as the extension.If you do not desire this action then provide a URL or data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the physics json data.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the physics data file. If undefined or `null` and no data is given the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.json".

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: An optional JSON data object. If given then the url is ignored and this JSON object is used for physics data instead.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the physics data.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: bitmapFont
functions.description: Adds Bitmap Font files to the current load queue.To create the Bitmap Font files you can use:BMFont (Windows, free): http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/Glyph Designer (OS X, commercial): http://www.71squared.com/en/glyphdesignerLittera (Web-based, free): http://kvazars.com/littera/You can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to an xml file.Or you can pass in an XML object or String via the `xmlData` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `Loader.parseXML` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If URLs are provided the files are **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but are added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getBitmapFont(key)`. XML files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the XML is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the XML file as needed.The URLs can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the textureURL isn't specified then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "megaFont" and textureURL is null then the Loader will set the URL to be "megaFont.png".The same is true for the atlasURL. If atlasURL isn't specified and no atlasData has been provided then the Loader willset the atlasURL to be the key. For example if the key is "megaFont" the atlasURL will be set to "megaFont.xml".If you do not desire this action then provide URLs and / or a data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the bitmap font.

parameters.name: textureURL
parameters.description: URL of the Bitmap Font texture file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "megaFont" then the URL will be "megaFont.png".

parameters.name: atlasURL
parameters.description: URL of the Bitmap Font atlas file (xml/json). If undefined or `null` AND `atlasData` is null, the url will be set to `<key>.xml`, i.e. if `key` was "megaFont" then the URL will be "megaFont.xml".

parameters.name: atlasData
parameters.description: An optional Bitmap Font atlas in string form (stringified xml/json).

parameters.name: xSpacing
parameters.description: If you'd like to add additional horizontal spacing between the characters then set the pixel value here.

parameters.name: ySpacing
parameters.description: If you'd like to add additional vertical spacing between the lines then set the pixel value here.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: atlasJSONArray
functions.description: Adds a Texture Atlas file to the current load queue.Unlike `Loader.atlasJSONHash` this call expects the atlas data to be in a JSON Array format.To create the Texture Atlas you can use tools such as:[Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker/phaser)[Shoebox](http://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)If using Texture Packer we recommend you enable "Trim sprite names".If your atlas software has an option to "rotate" the resulting frames, you must disable it.You can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to a json file.Or you can pass in a JSON object or String via the `atlasData` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `JSON.parse` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If URLs are provided the files are **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but are added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getImage(key)`. JSON files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the JSON is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the JSON file as needed.The URLs can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the textureURL isn't specified then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "player" and textureURL is null then the Loader will set the URL to be "player.png".The same is true for the atlasURL. If atlasURL isn't specified and no atlasData has been provided then the Loader willset the atlasURL to be the key. For example if the key is "player" the atlasURL will be set to "player.json".If you do not desire this action then provide URLs and / or a data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the texture atlas file.

parameters.name: textureURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas image file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png".

parameters.name: atlasURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas data file. If undefined or `null` and no atlasData is given, the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.json".

parameters.name: atlasData
parameters.description: A JSON data object. You don't need this if the data is being loaded from a URL.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: atlasJSONHash
functions.description: Adds a Texture Atlas file to the current load queue.Unlike `Loader.atlas` this call expects the atlas data to be in a JSON Hash format.To create the Texture Atlas you can use tools such as:[Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker/phaser)[Shoebox](http://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)If using Texture Packer we recommend you enable "Trim sprite names".If your atlas software has an option to "rotate" the resulting frames, you must disable it.You can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to a json file.Or you can pass in a JSON object or String via the `atlasData` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `JSON.parse` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If URLs are provided the files are **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but are added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getImage(key)`. JSON files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the JSON is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the JSON file as needed.The URLs can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the textureURL isn't specified then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "player" and textureURL is null then the Loader will set the URL to be "player.png".The same is true for the atlasURL. If atlasURL isn't specified and no atlasData has been provided then the Loader willset the atlasURL to be the key. For example if the key is "player" the atlasURL will be set to "player.json".If you do not desire this action then provide URLs and / or a data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the texture atlas file.

parameters.name: textureURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas image file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png".

parameters.name: atlasURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas data file. If undefined or `null` and no atlasData is given, the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.json".

parameters.name: atlasData
parameters.description: A JSON data object. You don't need this if the data is being loaded from a URL.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: atlasXML
functions.description: Adds a Texture Atlas file to the current load queue.This call expects the atlas data to be in the Starling XML data format.To create the Texture Atlas you can use tools such as:[Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker/phaser)[Shoebox](http://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)If using Texture Packer we recommend you enable "Trim sprite names".If your atlas software has an option to "rotate" the resulting frames, you must disable it.You can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to an xml file.Or you can pass in an XML object or String via the `atlasData` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `Loader.parseXML` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If URLs are provided the files are **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but are added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getImage(key)`. XML files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the XML is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the XML file as needed.The URLs can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the textureURL isn't specified then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "player" and textureURL is null then the Loader will set the URL to be "player.png".The same is true for the atlasURL. If atlasURL isn't specified and no atlasData has been provided then the Loader willset the atlasURL to be the key. For example if the key is "player" the atlasURL will be set to "player.xml".If you do not desire this action then provide URLs and / or a data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the texture atlas file.

parameters.name: textureURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas image file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png".

parameters.name: atlasURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas data file. If undefined or `null` and no atlasData is given, the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.xml".

parameters.name: atlasData
parameters.description: An XML data object. You don't need this if the data is being loaded from a URL.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: atlas
functions.description: Adds a Texture Atlas file to the current load queue.To create the Texture Atlas you can use tools such as:[Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker/phaser)[Shoebox](http://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)If using Texture Packer we recommend you enable "Trim sprite names".If your atlas software has an option to "rotate" the resulting frames, you must disable it.You can choose to either load the data externally, by providing a URL to a json file.Or you can pass in a JSON object or String via the `atlasData` parameter.If you pass a String the data is automatically run through `JSON.parse` and then immediately added to the Phaser.Cache.If URLs are provided the files are **not** loaded immediately after calling this method, but are added to the load queue.The key must be a unique String. It is used to add the file to the Phaser.Cache upon successful load.Retrieve the file via `Cache.getImage(key)`. JSON files are automatically parsed upon load.If you need to control when the JSON is parsed then use `Loader.text` instead and parse the JSON file as needed.The URLs can be relative or absolute. If the URL is relative the `Loader.baseURL` and `Loader.path` values will be prepended to it.If the textureURL isn't specified then the Loader will take the key and create a filename from that.For example if the key is "player" and textureURL is null then the Loader will set the URL to be "player.png".The same is true for the atlasURL. If atlasURL isn't specified and no atlasData has been provided then the Loader willset the atlasURL to be the key. For example if the key is "player" the atlasURL will be set to "player.json".If you do not desire this action then provide URLs and / or a data object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique asset key of the texture atlas file.

parameters.name: textureURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas image file. If undefined or `null` the url will be set to `<key>.png`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.png".

parameters.name: atlasURL
parameters.description: URL of the texture atlas data file. If undefined or `null` and no atlasData is given, the url will be set to `<key>.json`, i.e. if `key` was "alien" then the URL will be "alien.json".

parameters.name: atlasData
parameters.description: A JSON or XML data object. You don't need this if the data is being loaded from a URL.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the data. Can be Phaser.Loader.TEXTURE_ATLAS_JSON_ARRAY (the default), Phaser.Loader.TEXTURE_ATLAS_JSON_HASH or Phaser.Loader.TEXTURE_ATLAS_XML_STARLING.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: withSyncPoint
functions.description: Add a synchronization point to the assets / files added within the supplied callback.A synchronization point denotes that an asset _must_ be completely loaded beforesubsequent assets can be loaded. An asset marked as a sync-point does not need to waitfor previous assets to load (unless they are sync-points). Resources, such as packs, may stillbe downloaded around sync-points, as long as they do not finalize loading.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback is invoked and is supplied with a single argument: the loader.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: Context for the callback.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: addSyncPoint
functions.description: Add a synchronization point to a specific file/asset in the load queue.This has no effect on already loaded assets.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of resource to turn into a sync point (image, audio, xml, etc).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the file you want to turn into a sync point.

returns.description: This Loader instance.

functions.name: removeFile
functions.description: Remove a file/asset from the loading queue.A file that is loaded or has started loading cannot be removed.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of resource to add to the list (image, audio, xml, etc).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the file you want to remove.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Remove all file loading requests - this is _insufficient_ to stop current loading. Use `reset` instead.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Start loading the assets. Normally you don't need to call this yourself as the StateManager will do so.

functions.name: processLoadQueue
functions.description: Process the next item(s) in the file/asset queue.Process the queue and start loading enough items to fill up the inflight queue.If a sync-file is encountered then subsequent asset processing is delayed until it completes.The exception to this rule is that packfiles can be downloaded (but not processed) even ifthere appear other sync files (ie. packs) - this enables multiple packfiles to be fetched in parallel.such as during the start phaser.

functions.name: finishedLoading
functions.description: The loading is all finished.

parameters.name: abnormal
parameters.description: True if the loading finished abnormally.

functions.name: asyncComplete
functions.description: Informs the loader that the given file resource has been fetched and processed;or such a request has failed.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: The error message, if any. No message implies no error.

functions.name: processPack
functions.description: Process pack data. This will usually modify the file list.

functions.name: transformUrl
functions.description: Transforms the asset URL.The default implementation prepends the baseURL if the url doesn't begin with http or //

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url to transform.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file object being transformed.

returns.description: The transformed url. In rare cases where the url isn't specified it will return false instead.

functions.name: loadFile
functions.description: Start fetching a resource.All code paths, async or otherwise, from this function must return to `asyncComplete`.

functions.name: loadImageTag
functions.description: Continue async loading through an Image tag.

functions.name: loadVideoTag
functions.description: Continue async loading through a Video tag.

functions.name: loadAudioTag
functions.description: Continue async loading through an Audio tag.

functions.name: xhrLoad
functions.description: Starts the xhr loader.This is designed specifically to use with asset file processing.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file/pack to load.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the file.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The xhr responseType.

parameters.name: onload
parameters.description: The function to call on success. Invoked in `this` context and supplied with `(file, xhr)` arguments.

parameters.name: onerror
parameters.description: The function to call on error. Invoked in `this` context and supplied with `(file, xhr)` arguments.

functions.name: xhrLoad
functions.description: Starts the xhr loader - using XDomainRequest.This should _only_ be used with IE 9. Phaser does not support IE 8 and XDR is deprecated in IE 10.This is designed specifically to use with asset file processing.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file/pack to load.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the file.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The xhr responseType.

parameters.name: onload
parameters.description: The function to call on success. Invoked in `this` context and supplied with `(file, xhr)` arguments.

parameters.name: onerror
parameters.description: The function to call on error. Invoked in `this` context and supplied with `(file, xhr)` arguments.

functions.name: getVideoURL
functions.description: Give a bunch of URLs, return the first URL that has an extension this device thinks it can play.It is assumed that the device can play "blob:" or "data:" URIs - There is no mime-type checking on data URIs.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: See {@link #video} for format.

returns.description: The URL to try and fetch; or null.

functions.name: getAudioURL
functions.description: Give a bunch of URLs, return the first URL that has an extension this device thinks it can play.It is assumed that the device can play "blob:" or "data:" URIs - There is no mime-type checking on data URIs.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: See {@link #audio} for format.

returns.description: The URL to try and fetch; or null.

functions.name: fileError
functions.description: Error occurred when loading a file.

parameters.name: xhr
parameters.description: XHR request, unspecified if loaded via other means (eg. tags)

functions.name: fileComplete
functions.description: Called when a file has been downloaded and needs to be processed further.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File loaded

parameters.name: xhr
parameters.description: XHR request, unspecified if loaded via other means (eg. tags)

functions.name: jsonLoadComplete
functions.description: Successfully loaded a JSON file - only used for certain types.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File associated with this request

functions.name: csvLoadComplete
functions.description: Successfully loaded a CSV file - only used for certain types.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File associated with this request

functions.name: xmlLoadComplete
functions.description: Successfully loaded an XML file - only used for certain types.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File associated with this request

functions.name: parseXml
functions.description: Parses string data as XML.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The XML text to parse

returns.description: Returns the xml document, or null if such could not parsed to a valid document.

functions.name: nextFile
functions.description: Update the loading sprite progress.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Whether the previous asset loaded successfully or not.

functions.name: totalLoadedFiles
functions.description: Returns the number of files that have already been loaded, even if they errored.

returns.description: The number of files that have already been loaded (even if they errored)

functions.name: totalQueuedFiles
functions.description: Returns the number of files still waiting to be processed in the load queue. This value decreases as each file in the queue is loaded.

returns.description: The number of files that still remain in the load queue.

functions.name: totalLoadedPacks
functions.description: Returns the number of asset packs that have already been loaded, even if they errored.

returns.description: The number of asset packs that have already been loaded (even if they errored)

functions.name: totalQueuedPacks
functions.description: Returns the number of asset packs still waiting to be processed in the load queue. This value decreases as each pack in the queue is loaded.

returns.description: The number of asset packs that still remain in the load queue.

members.name: game
members.description: Local reference to game.

members.name: cache
members.description: Local reference to the Phaser.Cache.

members.name: resetLocked
members.description: If true all calls to Loader.reset will be ignored. Useful if you need to create a load queue before swapping to a preloader state.

members.name: isLoading
members.description: True if the Loader is in the process of loading the queue.

members.name: hasLoaded
members.description: True if all assets in the queue have finished loading.

members.name: preloadSprite
members.description: You can optionally link a progress sprite with {@link Phaser.Loader#setPreloadSprite setPreloadSprite}.This property is an object containing: sprite, rect, direction, width and height

members.name: crossOrigin
members.description: The crossOrigin value applied to loaded images. Very often this needs to be set to 'anonymous'.

members.name: baseURL
members.description: If you want to append a URL before the path of any asset you can set this here.Useful if allowing the asset base url to be configured outside of the game code.The string _must_ end with a "/".

members.name: path
members.description: The value of `path`, if set, is placed before any _relative_ file path given. For example:`load.path = "images/sprites/";load.image("ball", "ball.png");load.image("tree", "level1/oaktree.png");load.image("boom", "http://server.com/explode.png");`Would load the `ball` file from `images/sprites/ball.png` and the tree from`images/sprites/level1/oaktree.png` but the file `boom` would load from the URLgiven as it's an absolute URL.Please note that the path is added before the filename but *after* the baseURL (if set.)The string _must_ end with a "/".

members.name: headers
members.description: Used to map the application mime-types to to the Accept header in XHR requests.If you don't require these mappings, or they cause problems on your server, thenremove them from the headers object and the XHR request will not try to use them.This object can also be used to set the `X-Requested-With` header to `XMLHttpRequest` (or any other value you need). To enable this do:`this.load.headers.requestedWith = 'XMLHttpRequest'`before adding anything to the Loader. The XHR loader will then call:`setRequestHeader('X-Requested-With', this.headers['requestedWith'])`

members.name: onLoadStart
members.description: This event is dispatched when the loading process starts: before the first file has been requested,but after all the initial packs have been loaded.

members.name: onLoadComplete
members.description: This event is dispatched when the final file in the load queue has either loaded or failed.

members.name: onPackComplete
members.description: This event is dispatched when an asset pack has either loaded or failed to load.This is called when the asset pack manifest file has loaded and successfully added its contents to the loader queue.Params: `(pack key, success?, total packs loaded, total packs)`

members.name: onFileStart
members.description: This event is dispatched immediately before a file starts loading.It's possible the file may fail (eg. download error, invalid format) after this event is sent.Params: `(progress, file key, file url)`

members.name: onFileComplete
members.description: This event is dispatched when a file has either loaded or failed to load.Any function bound to this will receive the following parameters:progress, file key, success?, total loaded files, total filesWhere progress is a number between 1 and 100 (inclusive) representing the percentage of the load.

members.name: onFileError
members.description: This event is dispatched when a file (or pack) errors as a result of the load request.For files it will be triggered before `onFileComplete`. For packs it will be triggered before `onPackComplete`.Params: `(file key, file)`

members.name: useXDomainRequest
members.description: If true and if the browser supports XDomainRequest, it will be used in preference for XHR.This is only relevant for IE 9 and should _only_ be enabled for IE 9 clients when required by the server/CDN.

members.name: _warnedAboutXDomainRequest
members.description: Control number of warnings for using XDR outside of IE 9.

members.name: enableParallel
members.description: If true (the default) then parallel downloading will be enabled.To disable all parallel downloads this must be set to false prior to any resource being loaded.

members.name: maxParallelDownloads
members.description: The number of concurrent / parallel resources to try and fetch at once.Many current browsers limit 6 requests per domain; this is slightly conservative.

members.name: _withSyncPointDepth
members.description: A counter: if more than zero, files will be automatically added as a synchronization point.

members.name: _fileList
members.description: Contains all the information for asset files (including packs) to load.File/assets are only removed from the list after all loading completes.

members.name: _flightQueue
members.description: Inflight files (or packs) that are being fetched/processed.This means that if there are any files in the flight queue there should still be processinggoing on; it should only be empty before or after loading.The files in the queue may have additional properties added to them,including `requestObject` which is normally the associated XHR.

members.name: _processingHead
members.description: The offset into the fileList past all the complete (loaded or error) entries.

members.name: _fileLoadStarted
members.description: True when the first file (not pack) has loading started.This used to to control dispatching `onLoadStart` which happens after any initial packs are loaded.

members.name: _totalPackCount
members.description: Total packs seen - adjusted when a pack is added.

members.name: _totalFileCount
members.description: Total files seen - adjusted when a file is added.

members.name: _loadedPackCount
members.description: Total packs loaded - adjusted just prior to `onPackComplete`.

members.name: _loadedFileCount
members.description: Total files loaded - adjusted just prior to `onFileComplete`.

members.name: progressFloat
members.description: The non-rounded load progress value (from 0.0 to 100.0).A general indicator of the progress.It is possible for the progress to decrease, after `onLoadStart`, if more files are dynamically added.

members.name: progress
members.description: The rounded load progress percentage value (from 0 to 100). See {@link Phaser.Loader#progressFloat}.

functions.name: snapTo
functions.description: Snap a value to nearest grid slice, using rounding.Example: if you have an interval gap of 5 and a position of 12... you will snap to 10 whereas 14 will snap to 15.

parameters.description: The value to snap.

parameters.name: gap
parameters.description: The interval gap of the grid.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Optional starting offset for gap.

returns.description: The snapped value.

functions.name: snapToFloor

parameters.description: The value to snap.

parameters.name: gap
parameters.description: The interval gap of the grid.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Optional starting offset for gap.

returns.description: The snapped value.

functions.name: snapToCeil
functions.description: Snap a value to nearest grid slice, using ceil.Example: if you have an interval gap of 5 and a position of 12... you will snap to 15.As will 14 will snap to 15... but 16 will snap to 20.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: The value to snap.

parameters.name: gap
parameters.description: The interval gap of the grid.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Optional starting offset for gap.

returns.description: The snapped value.

parameters.name: value

functions.name: floorTo

parameters.description: The value to round.

parameters.name: place
parameters.description: The place to round to.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: The base to round in. Default is 10 for decimal.

returns.description: The rounded value.

functions.name: ceilTo
functions.description: Ceils to some place comparative to a `base`, default is 10 for decimal place.The `place` is represented by the power applied to `base` to get that place.

parameters.description: The place to round to.

functions.name: rotateToAngle
functions.description: Rotates currentAngle towards targetAngle, taking the shortest rotation distance.The lerp argument is the amount to rotate by in this call.

parameters.name: currentAngle
parameters.description: The current angle, in radians.

parameters.name: targetAngle
parameters.description: The target angle to rotate to, in radians.

parameters.name: lerp
parameters.description: The lerp value to add to the current angle.

returns.description: The adjusted angle.

functions.name: getShortestAngle
functions.description: Gets the shortest angle between `angle1` and `angle2`.Both angles must be in the range -180 to 180, which is the same clampedrange that `sprite.angle` uses, so you can pass in two sprite angles tothis method, and get the shortest angle back between the two of them.The angle returned will be in the same range. If the returned angle isgreater than 0 then it's a counter-clockwise rotation, if < 0 then it'sa clockwise rotation.

parameters.name: angle1
parameters.description: The first angle. In the range -180 to 180.

parameters.name: angle2
parameters.description: The second angle. In the range -180 to 180.

returns.description: The shortest angle, in degrees. If greater than zero it's a counter-clockwise rotation.
