classes.name: Phaser.Tween
classes.description: A Tween allows you to alter one or more properties of a target object over a defined period of time.This can be used for things such as alpha fading Sprites, scaling them or motion.Use `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` to set-up the tween values. You can create multiple tweens on the same objectby calling Tween.to multiple times on the same Tween. Additional tweens specified in this way become "child" tweens andare played through in sequence. You can use Tween.timeScale and Tween.reverse to control the playback of this Tween and all of its children.

constructor.name: Tween
constructor.description: A Tween allows you to alter one or more properties of a target object over a defined period of time.This can be used for things such as alpha fading Sprites, scaling them or motion.Use `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` to set-up the tween values. You can create multiple tweens on the same objectby calling Tween.to multiple times on the same Tween. Additional tweens specified in this way become "child" tweens andare played through in sequence. You can use Tween.timeScale and Tween.reverse to control the playback of this Tween and all of its children.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target object, such as a Phaser.Sprite or Phaser.Sprite.scale.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Current game instance.

parameters.name: manager
parameters.description: The TweenManager responsible for looking after this Tween.

functions.name: to
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object containing the properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms. Or if `Tween.frameBased` is true this represents the number of frames that should elapse.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.description: Set to `true` to allow this tween to start automatically. Otherwise call Tween.start().

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start in milliseconds. Defaults to 0, no delay.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This only effects this individual tween, not any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: from
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween sets the target to the destination value and tweens to its current value.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 tweened from `x` 500 would be set to `x` 500 and then tweened to `x` 100 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 500 }`.The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object containing the properties you want to tween., such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms. Or if `Tween.frameBased` is true this represents the number of frames that should elapse.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.description: Set to `true` to allow this tween to start automatically. Otherwise call Tween.start().

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start in milliseconds. Defaults to 0, no delay.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This only effects this individual tween, not any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the tween running. Can also be called by the autoStart parameter of `Tween.to` or `Tween.from`.This sets the `Tween.isRunning` property to `true` and dispatches a `Tween.onStart` signal.If the Tween has a delay set then nothing will start tweening until the delay has expired.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this Tween contains child tweens you can specify which one to start from. The default is zero, i.e. the first tween created.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops the tween if running and flags it for deletion from the TweenManager.If called directly the `Tween.onComplete` signal is not dispatched and no chained tweens are started unless the complete parameter is set to `true`.If you just wish to pause a tween then use Tween.pause instead.

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: Set to `true` to dispatch the Tween.onComplete signal.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: updateTweenData
functions.description: Updates either a single TweenData or all TweenData objects properties to the given value.Used internally by methods like Tween.delay, Tween.yoyo, etc. but can also be called directly if you know which property you want to tweak.The property is not checked, so if you pass an invalid one you'll generate a run-time error.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to update.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the property to.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the delay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: delay
functions.description: Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will start. If there are child tweens it sets the delay before the first child starts.The delay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to delay.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the delay across all of them.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it begins once started is called. Set to zero to remove any active delay.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the delay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: repeat
functions.description: Sets the number of times this tween will repeat.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to repeat.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the number of times they'll repeat across all of them.If you wish to define how many times this Tween and all children will repeat see Tween.repeatAll.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: How many times a tween should repeat before completing. Set to zero to remove an active repeat. Set to -1 to repeat forever.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: This is the amount of time to pause (in ms) before the repeat will start.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the repeat value on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: repeatDelay
functions.description: Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will repeat itself.The repeatDelay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to set repeatDelay on.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the repeatDelay across all of them.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it repeats or yoyos once start is called. Set to zero to remove any active repeatDelay.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the repeatDelay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: yoyo
functions.description: A Tween that has yoyo set to true will run through from its starting values to its end values and then play back in reverse from end to start.Used in combination with repeat you can create endless loops.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to yoyo.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the yoyo property across all of them.If you wish to yoyo this Tween and all of its children then see Tween.yoyoAll.

parameters.name: enable
parameters.description: Set to true to yoyo this tween, or false to disable an already active yoyo.

parameters.name: yoyoDelay
parameters.description: This is the amount of time to pause (in ms) before the yoyo will start.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set yoyo on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: yoyoDelay
functions.description: Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will run a yoyo (only applies if yoyo is enabled).The repeatDelay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to set repeatDelay on.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the repeatDelay across all of them.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it repeats or yoyos once start is called. Set to zero to remove any active yoyoDelay.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the yoyoDelay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: easing
functions.description: Set easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the easing function defined here across all of them.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: The easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the easing function on all children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: interpolation
functions.description: Sets the interpolation function the tween will use. By default it uses Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation.Also available: Phaser.Math.bezierInterpolation and Phaser.Math.catmullRomInterpolation.The interpolation function is only used if the target properties is an array.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value and it will set the interpolation function across all of them.

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.description: The interpolation function to use (Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation by default)

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context under which the interpolation function will be run.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the interpolation function on all children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: repeatAll
functions.description: Set how many times this tween and all of its children will repeat.A tween (A) with 3 children (B,C,D) with a `repeatAll` value of 2 would play as: ABCDABCD before completing.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: How many times this tween and all children should repeat before completing. Set to zero to remove an active repeat. Set to -1 to repeat forever.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: chain
functions.description: This method allows you to chain tweens together. Any tween chained to this tween will have its `Tween.start` method calledas soon as this tween completes. If this tween never completes (i.e. repeatAll or loop is set) then the chain will never progress.Note that `Tween.onComplete` will fire when *this* tween completes, not when the whole chain completes.For that you should listen to `onComplete` on the final tween in your chain.If you pass multiple tweens to this method they will be joined into a single long chain.For example if this is Tween A and you pass in B, C and D then B will be chained to A, C will be chained to B and D will be chained to C.Any previously chained tweens that may have been set will be overwritten.

parameters.name: tweens
parameters.description: One or more tweens that will be chained to this one.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: loop
functions.description: Enables the looping of this tween. The tween will loop forever, and onComplete will never fire.If `value` is `true` then this is the same as setting `Tween.repeatAll(-1)`.If `value` is `false` it is the same as setting `Tween.repeatAll(0)` and will reset the `repeatCounter` to zero.Usage:game.add.tween(p).to({ x: 700 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None, true).to({ y: 300 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None).to({ x: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None).to({ y: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None).loop();

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: If `true` this tween will loop once it reaches the end. Set to `false` to remove an active loop.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: onUpdateCallback
functions.description: Sets a callback to be fired each time this tween updates.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback to invoke each time this tween is updated. Set to `null` to remove an already active callback.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: pause
functions.description: Pauses the tween. Resume playback with Tween.resume.

functions.name: _pause
functions.description: This is called by the core Game loop. Do not call it directly, instead use Tween.pause.

functions.name: resume
functions.description: Resumes a paused tween.

functions.name: _resume
functions.description: This is called by the core Game loop. Do not call it directly, instead use Tween.pause.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Core tween update function called by the TweenManager. Does not need to be invoked directly.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: A timestamp passed in by the TweenManager.

returns.description: false if the tween and all child tweens have completed and should be deleted from the manager, otherwise true (still active).

functions.name: generateData
functions.description: This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.It works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and Tween.from.It ignores delay and repeat counts and any chained tweens, but does include child tweens.Just one play through of the tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: If given the generated data will be appended to this array, otherwise a new array will be returned.

returns.description: An array of tweened values.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: target
members.description: The target object, such as a Phaser.Sprite or property like Phaser.Sprite.scale.

members.name: manager
members.description: Reference to the TweenManager responsible for updating this Tween.

members.name: timeline
members.description: An Array of TweenData objects that comprise the different parts of this Tween.

members.name: reverse
members.description: If set to `true` the current tween will play in reverse.If the tween hasn't yet started this has no effect.If there are child tweens then all child tweens will play in reverse from the current point.

members.name: timeScale
members.description: The speed at which the tweens will run. A value of 1 means it will match the game frame rate. 0.5 will run at half the frame rate. 2 at double the frame rate, etc.If a tweens duration is 1 second but timeScale is 0.5 then it will take 2 seconds to complete.

members.name: repeatCounter
members.description: If the Tween and any child tweens are set to repeat this contains the current repeat count.

members.name: pendingDelete
members.description: True if this Tween is ready to be deleted by the TweenManager.

members.name: onStart
members.description: The onStart event is fired when the Tween begins. If there is a delay before the tween starts then onStart fires after the delay is finished.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onLoop
members.description: The onLoop event is fired if the Tween, or any child tweens loop.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onRepeat
members.description: The onRepeat event is fired if the Tween and all of its children repeats. If this tween has no children this will never be fired.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onChildComplete
members.description: The onChildComplete event is fired when the Tween or any of its children completes.Fires every time a child completes unless a child is set to repeat forever.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onComplete
members.description: The onComplete event is fired when the Tween and all of its children completes. Does not fire if the Tween is set to loop or repeatAll(-1).It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: isRunning
members.description: If the tween is running this is set to true, otherwise false. Tweens that are in a delayed state or waiting to start are considered as being running.

members.name: current
members.description: The current Tween child being run.

members.name: properties
members.description: Target property cache used when building the child data values.

members.name: chainedTween
members.description: If this Tween is chained to another this holds a reference to it.

members.name: isPaused
members.description: Is this Tween paused or not?

members.name: frameBased
members.description: Is this Tween frame or time based? A frame based tween will use the physics elapsed timer when updating. This meansit will retain the same consistent frame rate, regardless of the speed of the device. The duration value given shouldbe given in frames.If the Tween uses a time based update (which is the default) then the duration is given in milliseconds.In this situation a 2000ms tween will last exactly 2 seconds, regardless of the device and how many visual updates the tweenhas actually been through. For very short tweens you may wish to experiment with a frame based update instead.The default value is whatever you've set in TweenManager.frameBased.

members.name: _onUpdateCallback
members.description: An onUpdate callback.

members.name: _onUpdateCallbackContext
members.description: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.

members.name: _pausedTime
members.description: Private pause timer.

members.name: _codePaused
members.description: Was the Tween paused by code or by Game focus loss?

members.name: _hasStarted
members.description: Internal var to track if the Tween has started yet or not.

members.name: totalDuration
members.description: Gets the total duration of this Tween, including all child tweens, in milliseconds.

classes.name: Phaser.TweenData
classes.description: A Phaser.Tween contains at least one TweenData object. It contains all of the tween data values, such as thestarting and ending values, the ease function, interpolation and duration. The Tween acts as a timeline manager forTweenData objects and can contain multiple TweenData objects.

constructor.name: TweenData
constructor.description: A Phaser.Tween contains at least one TweenData object. It contains all of the tween data values, such as thestarting and ending values, the ease function, interpolation and duration. The Tween acts as a timeline manager forTweenData objects and can contain multiple TweenData objects.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The Tween that owns this TweenData object.

functions.name: to
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: from
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween sets the target to the destination value and tweens to its current value.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 tweened from `x` 500 would be set to `x` 500 and then tweened to `x` 100 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 500 }`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the Tween running.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: loadValues
functions.description: Loads the values from the target object into this Tween.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates this Tween. This is called automatically by Phaser.Tween.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: A timestamp passed in by the Tween parent.

returns.description: The current status of this Tween. One of the Phaser.TweenData constants: PENDING, RUNNING, LOOPED or COMPLETE.

functions.name: generateData
functions.description: This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.It works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and Tween.from.Just one play through of the tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

returns.description: An array of tweened values.

functions.name: repeat
functions.description: Checks if this Tween is meant to repeat or yoyo and handles doing so.

returns.description: Either Phaser.TweenData.LOOPED or Phaser.TweenData.COMPLETE.

members.name: parent
members.description: The Tween which owns this TweenData.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: vStart
members.description: An object containing the values at the start of the tween.

members.name: vStartCache
members.description: Cached starting values.

members.name: vEnd
members.description: An object containing the values at the end of the tween.

members.name: vEndCache
members.description: Cached ending values.

members.name: duration
members.description: The duration of the tween in ms.

members.name: percent
members.description: A value between 0 and 1 that represents how far through the duration this tween is.

members.name: value
members.description: The current calculated value.

members.name: repeatCounter
members.description: If the Tween is set to repeat this contains the current repeat count.

members.name: repeatDelay
members.description: The amount of time in ms between repeats of this tween.

members.name: repeatTotal
members.description: The total number of times this Tween will repeat.

members.name: interpolate
members.description: True if the Tween will use interpolation (i.e. is an Array to Array tween)

members.name: yoyo
members.description: True if the Tween is set to yoyo, otherwise false.

members.name: yoyoDelay
members.description: The amount of time in ms between yoyos of this tween.

members.name: inReverse
members.description: When a Tween is yoyoing this value holds if it's currently playing forwards (false) or in reverse (true).

members.name: delay
members.description: The amount to delay by until the Tween starts (in ms). Only applies to the start, use repeatDelay to handle repeats.

members.name: dt
members.description: Current time value.

members.name: startTime
members.description: The time the Tween started or null if it hasn't yet started.

members.name: easingFunction
members.description: The easing function used for the Tween.

members.name: interpolationFunction
members.description: The interpolation function used for the Tween.

members.name: interpolationContext
members.description: The interpolation function context used for the Tween.

members.name: isRunning
members.description: If the tween is running this is set to `true`. Unless Phaser.Tween a TweenData that is waiting for a delay to expire is *not* considered as running.

members.name: isFrom
members.description: Is this a from tween or a to tween?

classes.name: Phaser.TweenManager
classes.description: Phaser.Game has a single instance of the TweenManager through which all Tween objects are created and updated.Tweens are hooked into the game clock and pause system, adjusting based on the game state.TweenManager is based heavily on tween.js by http://soledadpenades.com.The difference being that tweens belong to a games instance of TweenManager, rather than to a global TWEEN object.It also has callbacks swapped for Signals and a few issues patched with regard to properties and completion errors.Please see https://github.com/sole/tween.js for a full list of contributors.

constructor.name: TweenManager
constructor.description: Phaser.Game has a single instance of the TweenManager through which all Tween objects are created and updated.Tweens are hooked into the game clock and pause system, adjusting based on the game state.TweenManager is based heavily on tween.js by http://soledadpenades.com.The difference being that tweens belong to a games instance of TweenManager, rather than to a global TWEEN object.It also has callbacks swapped for Signals and a few issues patched with regard to properties and completion errors.Please see https://github.com/sole/tween.js for a full list of contributors.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Get all the tween objects in an array.

returns.description: Array with all tween objects.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Remove all tweens running and in the queue. Doesn't call any of the tween onComplete events.

functions.name: removeFrom
functions.description: Remove all tweens from a specific object, array of objects or Group.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object you want to remove the tweens from.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: If passing a group, setting this to true will remove the tweens from all of its children instead of the group itself.

functions.name: add

parameters.name: tween
parameters.description: The tween object you want to add.

returns.description: The tween object you added to the manager.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Create a tween object for a specific object. The object can be any JavaScript object or Phaser object such as Sprite.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: Object the tween will be run on.

returns.description: The newly created tween object.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a tween from this manager.

parameters.name: tween
parameters.description: The tween object you want to remove.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Update all the tween objects you added to this manager.

returns.description: Return false if there's no tween to update, otherwise return true.

functions.name: isTweening
functions.description: Checks to see if a particular Sprite is currently being tweened.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object to check for tweens against.

returns.description: Returns true if the object is currently being tweened, false if not.

functions.name: _pauseAll

functions.name: _resumeAll
functions.description: Private. Called by game focus loss. Resumes all currently paused tweens.

functions.name: pauseAll
functions.description: Pauses all currently running tweens.

functions.name: resumeAll
functions.description: Resumes all currently paused tweens.

members.name: game
members.description: Local reference to game.

members.name: frameBased
members.description: Are all newly created Tweens frame or time based? A frame based tween will use the physics elapsed timer when updating. This meansit will retain the same consistent frame rate, regardless of the speed of the device. The duration value given shouldbe given in frames.If the Tween uses a time based update (which is the default) then the duration is given in milliseconds.In this situation a 2000ms tween will last exactly 2 seconds, regardless of the device and how many visual updates the tweenhas actually been through. For very short tweens you may wish to experiment with a frame based update instead.

members.name: _tweens

members.name: _add
