classes.name: Phaser.ArraySet
classes.description: ArraySet is a Set data structure (items must be unique within the set) that also maintains order.This allows specific items to be easily added or removed from the Set.Item equality (and uniqueness) is determined by the behavior of `Array.indexOf`.This used primarily by the Input subsystem.

constructor.name: ArraySet
constructor.description: ArraySet is a Set data structure (items must be unique within the set) that also maintains order.This allows specific items to be easily added or removed from the Set.Item equality (and uniqueness) is determined by the behavior of `Array.indexOf`.This used primarily by the Input subsystem.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The backing array: if specified the items in the list _must_ be unique, per `Array.indexOf`, and the ownership of the array _should_ be relinquished to the ArraySet.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds a new element to the end of the list.If the item already exists in the list it is not moved.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to add to this list.

returns.description: The item that was added.

functions.name: getIndex
functions.description: Gets the index of the item in the list, or -1 if it isn't in the list.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to get the list index for.

returns.description: The index of the item or -1 if not found.

functions.name: getByKey
functions.description: Gets an item from the set based on the property strictly equaling the value given.Returns null if not found.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to check against the value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to check if the property strictly equals.

returns.description: The item that was found, or null if nothing matched.

functions.name: exists
functions.description: Checks for the item within this list.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to get the list index for.

returns.description: True if the item is found in the list, otherwise false.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Removes all the items.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes the given element from this list if it exists.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to be removed from the list.

returns.description: item - The item that was removed.

functions.name: setAll
functions.description: Sets the property `key` to the given value on all members of this list.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property of the item to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the property to.

functions.name: callAll
functions.description: Calls a function on all members of this list, using the member as the context for the callback.If the `key` property is present it must be a function.The function is invoked using the item as the context.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the property with the function to call.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes every member from this ArraySet and optionally destroys it.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: Call `destroy` on each member as it's removed from this set.

members.name: position
members.description: Current cursor position as established by `first` and `next`.

members.name: list
members.description: The backing array.

members.name: total
members.description: Number of items in the ArraySet. Same as `list.length`.

members.name: first
members.description: Returns the first item and resets the cursor to the start.

members.name: next
members.description: Returns the the next item (based on the cursor) and advances the cursor.

classes.name: Phaser.ArrayUtils
classes.description: Utility functions for dealing with Arrays.

constructor.name: ArrayUtils
constructor.description: Utility functions for dealing with Arrays.

functions.name: getRandomItem
functions.description: Fetch a random entry from the given array.Will return null if there are no array items that fall within the specified rangeor if there is no item for the randomly chosen index.

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: An array of objects.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.description: The random object that was selected.

functions.name: removeRandomItem
functions.description: Removes a random object from the given array and returns it.Will return null if there are no array items that fall within the specified rangeor if there is no item for the randomly chosen index.

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: An array of objects.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.description: The random object that was removed.

functions.name: shuffle
functions.description: A standard Fisher-Yates Array shuffle implementation which modifies the array in place.

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The array to shuffle.

returns.description: The original array, now shuffled.

functions.name: transposeMatrix
functions.description: Transposes the elements of the given matrix (array of arrays).

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The matrix to transpose.

returns.description: A new transposed matrix

functions.name: rotateMatrix
functions.description: Rotates the given matrix (array of arrays).Based on the routine from {@link http://jsfiddle.net/MrPolywhirl/NH42z/}.

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: The array to rotate; this matrix _may_ be altered.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The amount to rotate: the rotation in degrees (90, -90, 270, -270, 180) or a string command ('rotateLeft', 'rotateRight' or 'rotate180').

returns.description: The rotated matrix. The source matrix should be discarded for the returned matrix.

functions.name: findClosest
functions.description: Snaps a value to the nearest value in an array.The result will always be in the range `[first_value, last_value]`.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The search value

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: The input array which _must_ be sorted.

returns.description: The nearest value found.

functions.name: rotateRight
functions.description: Moves the element from the end of the array to the start, shifting all items in the process.The "rotation" happens to the right.Before: `[ A, B, C, D, E, F ]`After: `[ F, A, B, C, D, E ]`See also Phaser.ArrayUtils.rotateLeft.

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The array to rotate. The array is modified.

returns.description: The shifted value.

functions.name: rotateLeft
functions.description: Moves the element from the start of the array to the end, shifting all items in the process.The "rotation" happens to the left.Before: `[ A, B, C, D, E, F ]`After: `[ B, C, D, E, F, A ]`See also Phaser.ArrayUtils.rotateRight

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The array to rotate. The array is modified.

returns.description: The rotated value.

functions.name: rotate
functions.description: Moves the element from the start of the array to the end, shifting all items in the process.The "rotation" happens to the left.Before: `[ A, B, C, D, E, F ]`After: `[ B, C, D, E, F, A ]`See also Phaser.ArrayUtils.rotateRight

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The array to rotate. The array is modified.

returns.description: The rotated value.

functions.name: numberArray
functions.description: Create an array representing the inclusive range of numbers (usually integers) in `[start, end]`.This is equivalent to `numberArrayStep(start, end, 1)`.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The minimum value the array starts with.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The maximum value the array contains.

returns.description: The array of number values.

functions.name: numberArrayStep
functions.description: Create an array of numbers (positive and/or negative) progressing from `start`up to but not including `end` by advancing by `step`.If `start` is less than `end` a zero-length range is created unless a negative `step` is specified.Certain values for `start` and `end` (eg. NaN/undefined/null) are currently coerced to 0;for forward compatibility make sure to pass in actual numbers.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start of the range.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end of the range.

parameters.name: step
parameters.description: The value to increment or decrement by.

returns.description: Returns the new array of numbers.

classes.name: Phaser.Canvas
classes.description: The Canvas class handles everything related to creating the `canvas` DOM tag that Phaser will use, including styles, offset and aspect ratio.

constructor.name: Canvas
constructor.description: The Canvas class handles everything related to creating the `canvas` DOM tag that Phaser will use, including styles, offset and aspect ratio.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a `canvas` DOM element. The element is not automatically added to the document.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The object that will own the canvas that is created.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the canvas element.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the canvas element..

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: If specified, and not the empty string, this will be set as the ID of the canvas element. Otherwise no ID will be set.

parameters.name: skipPool
parameters.description: If `true` the canvas will not be placed in the CanvasPool global.

returns.description: The newly created canvas element.

functions.name: setBackgroundColor
functions.description: Sets the background color behind the canvas. This changes the canvas style property.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to set the background color on.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color to set. Can be in the format 'rgb(r,g,b)', or '#RRGGBB' or any valid CSS color.

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

functions.name: setTouchAction
functions.description: Sets the touch-action property on the canvas style. Can be used to disable default browser touch actions.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to set the touch action on.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The touch action to set. Defaults to 'none'.

returns.description: The source canvas.

functions.name: setUserSelect
functions.description: Sets the user-select property on the canvas style. Can be used to disable default browser selection actions.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to set the touch action on.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The touch action to set. Defaults to 'none'.

returns.description: The source canvas.

functions.name: addToDOM
functions.description: Adds the given canvas element to the DOM. The canvas will be added as a child of the given parent.If no parent is given it will be added as a child of the document.body.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to be added to the DOM.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The DOM element to add the canvas to.

parameters.name: overflowHidden
parameters.description: If set to true it will add the overflow='hidden' style to the parent DOM element.

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

functions.name: removeFromDOM
functions.description: Removes the given canvas element from the DOM.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to be removed from the DOM.

functions.name: setTransform
functions.description: Sets the transform of the given canvas to the matrix values provided.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to set the transform on.

parameters.name: translateX
parameters.description: The value to translate horizontally by.

parameters.name: translateY
parameters.description: The value to translate vertically by.

parameters.name: scaleX
parameters.description: The value to scale horizontally by.

parameters.name: scaleY
parameters.description: The value to scale vertically by.

parameters.name: skewX
parameters.description: The value to skew horizontaly by.

parameters.name: skewY
parameters.description: The value to skew vertically by.

returns.description: Returns the source context.

functions.name: setSmoothingEnabled
functions.description: Sets the Image Smoothing property on the given context. Set to false to disable image smoothing.By default browsers have image smoothing enabled, which isn't always what you visually want, especiallywhen using pixel art in a game. Note that this sets the property on the context itself, so that any imagedrawn to the context will be affected. This sets the property across all current browsers but support ispatchy on earlier browsers, especially on mobile.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to enable or disable the image smoothing on.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: If set to true it will enable image smoothing, false will disable it.

returns.description: Returns the source context.

functions.name: getSmoothingPrefix
functions.description: Gets the Smoothing Enabled vendor prefix being used on the given context, or null if not set.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to enable or disable the image smoothing on.

returns.description: Returns the smoothingEnabled vendor prefix, or null if not set on the context.

functions.name: getSmoothingEnabled
functions.description: Returns `true` if the given context has image smoothing enabled, otherwise returns `false`.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context to check for smoothing on.

returns.description: True if the given context has image smoothing enabled, otherwise false.

functions.name: setImageRenderingCrisp
functions.description: Sets the CSS image-rendering property on the given canvas to be 'crisp' (aka 'optimize contrast' on webkit).Note that if this doesn't given the desired result then see the setSmoothingEnabled.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to set image-rendering crisp on.

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

functions.name: setImageRenderingBicubic
functions.description: Sets the CSS image-rendering property on the given canvas to be 'bicubic' (aka 'auto').Note that if this doesn't given the desired result then see the CanvasUtils.setSmoothingEnabled method.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas to set image-rendering bicubic on.

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

classes.name: Phaser.CanvasPool
classes.description: The CanvasPool is a global static object, that allows Phaser to recycle and pool Canvas DOM elements.

constructor.name: CanvasPool
constructor.description: The CanvasPool is a global static object, that allows Phaser to recycle and pool Canvas DOM elements.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new Canvas DOM element, or pulls one from the pool if free.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent of the canvas element.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the canvas element.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the canvas element.

returns.description: The canvas element.

functions.name: getFirst
functions.description: Gets the first free canvas index from the pool.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Looks up a canvas based on its parent, and if found puts it back in the pool, freeing it up for re-use.The canvas has its width and height set to 1, and its parent attribute nulled.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent of the canvas element.

functions.name: removeByCanvas
functions.description: Looks up a canvas based on its type, and if found puts it back in the pool, freeing it up for re-use.The canvas has its width and height set to 1, and its parent attribute nulled.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The canvas element to remove.

functions.name: getTotal
functions.description: Gets the total number of used canvas elements in the pool.

returns.description: The number of in-use (parented) canvas elements in the pool.

functions.name: getFree
functions.description: Gets the total number of free canvas elements in the pool.

returns.description: The number of free (un-parented) canvas elements in the pool.

members.name: pool
members.description: The pool into which the canvas elements are placed.

classes.name: Phaser.Color
classes.description: The Phaser.Color class is a set of static methods that assist in color manipulation and conversion.

constructor.name: Color
constructor.description: The Phaser.Color class is a set of static methods that assist in color manipulation and conversion.

functions.name: packPixel
functions.description: Packs the r, g, b, a components into a single integer, for use with Int32Array.If device is little endian then ABGR order is used. Otherwise RGBA order is used.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: The packed color as uint32

functions.name: unpackPixel
functions.description: Unpacks the r, g, b, a components into the specified color object, or a newobject, for use with Int32Array. If little endian, then ABGR order is used whenunpacking, otherwise, RGBA order is used. The resulting color object has the`r, g, b, a` properties which are unrelated to endianness.Note that the integer is assumed to be packed in the correct endianness. On little-endianthe format is 0xAABBGGRR and on big-endian the format is 0xRRGGBBAA. If you want aendian-independent method, use fromRGBA(rgba) and toRGBA(r, g, b, a).

parameters.name: rgba
parameters.description: The integer, packed in endian order by packPixel.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.

parameters.name: hsl
parameters.description: Also convert the rgb values into hsl?

parameters.name: hsv
parameters.description: Also convert the rgb values into hsv?

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

functions.name: fromRGBA
functions.description: A utility to convert an integer in 0xRRGGBBAA format to a color object.This does not rely on endianness.

parameters.name: rgba
parameters.description: An RGBA hex

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: The object to use, optional.

returns.description: A color object.

functions.name: toRGBA
functions.description: A utility to convert RGBA components to a 32 bit integer in RRGGBBAA format.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: A RGBA-packed 32 bit integer

functions.name: toABGR
functions.description: Converts RGBA components to a 32 bit integer in AABBGGRR format.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: A RGBA-packed 32 bit integer

functions.name: hexToRGBArray
functions.description: Converts a hex color value to an [R, G, B] array.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color to convert to an RGB array. In the format 0xRRGGBB.

returns.description: An array with element 0 containing the Red value, 1 containing Green, and 2 containing Blue.

functions.name: RGBArrayToHex
functions.description: Converts an RGB color array, in the format: [R, G, B], to a hex color value.

parameters.name: rgb
parameters.description: An array with element 0 containing the Red value, 1 containing Green, and 2 containing Blue.

returns.description: The color value, in the format 0xRRGGBB.

functions.name: RGBtoHSL
functions.description: Converts an RGB color value to HSL (hue, saturation and lightness).Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.Assumes RGB values are contained in the set [0, 255] and returns h, s and l in the set [0, 1].Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created, h, s and l. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the hue, saturation and lightness values set in the h, s and l properties.

functions.name: HSLtoRGB
functions.description: Converts an HSL (hue, saturation and lightness) color value to RGB.Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.Assumes HSL values are contained in the set [0, 1] and returns r, g and b values in the set [0, 255].Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: The lightness, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

functions.name: RGBtoHSV
functions.description: Converts an RGB color value to HSV (hue, saturation and value).Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.Assumes RGB values are contained in the set [0, 255] and returns h, s and v in the set [0, 1].Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created, h, s and v. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the hue, saturation and value set in the h, s and v properties.

functions.name: HSVtoRGB
functions.description: Converts an HSV (hue, saturation and value) color value to RGB.Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.Assumes HSV values are contained in the set [0, 1] and returns r, g and b values in the set [0, 255].Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: The value, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

functions.name: hueToColor
functions.description: Converts a hue to an RGB color.Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

returns.description: The color component value.

functions.name: createColor
functions.description: A utility function to create a lightweight 'color' object with the default components.Any components that are not specified will default to zero.This is useful when you want to use a shared color object for the getPixel and getPixelAt methods.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: The lightness, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: The value, in the range 0 - 1.

returns.description: The resulting object with r, g, b, a properties and h, s, l and v.

functions.name: updateColor
functions.description: Takes a color object and updates the rgba, color and color32 properties.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: The color object to update.

returns.description: A native color value integer (format: 0xAARRGGBB).

functions.name: getColor32
functions.description: Given an alpha and 3 color values this will return an integer representation of it.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: A native color value integer (format: 0xAARRGGBB).

functions.name: getColor
functions.description: Given 3 color values this will return an integer representation of it.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: A native color value integer (format: 0xRRGGBB).

functions.name: RGBtoString
functions.description: Converts the given color values into a string.If prefix was '#' it will be in the format `#RRGGBB` otherwise `0xAARRGGBB`.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The prefix used in the return string. If '#' it will return `#RRGGBB`, else `0xAARRGGBB`.

returns.description: A string containing the color values. If prefix was '#' it will be in the format `#RRGGBB` otherwise `0xAARRGGBB`.

functions.name: hexToRGB
functions.description: Converts a hex string into an integer color value.

parameters.name: hex
parameters.description: The hex string to convert. Can be in the short-hand format `#03f` or `#0033ff`.

returns.description: The rgb color value in the format 0xAARRGGBB.

functions.name: hexToColor
functions.description: Converts a hex string into a Phaser Color object.The hex string can supplied as `'#0033ff'` or the short-hand format of `'#03f'`; it can begin with an optional "#" or "0x", or be unprefixed.    An alpha channel is _not_ supported.

parameters.name: hex
parameters.description: The color string in a hex format.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created or set: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

functions.name: webToColor
functions.description: Converts a CSS 'web' string into a Phaser Color object.The web string can be in the format `'rgb(r,g,b)'` or `'rgba(r,g,b,a)'` where r/g/b are in the range [0..255] and a is in the range [0..1].

parameters.name: web
parameters.description: The color string in CSS 'web' format.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 4 properties will be created: r, g, b and a. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the red, green, blue and alpha values set in the r, g, b and a properties.

functions.name: valueToColor
functions.description: Converts a value - a "hex" string, a "CSS 'web' string", or a number - into red, green, blue, and alpha components.The value can be a string (see `hexToColor` and `webToColor` for the supported formats) or a packed integer (see `getRGB`).An alpha channel is _not_ supported when specifying a hex string.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The color expressed as a recognized string format or a packed integer.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: The object to use for the output. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: The (`out`) object with the red, green, blue, and alpha values set as the r/g/b/a properties.

functions.name: componentToHex
functions.description: Return a string containing a hex representation of the given color component.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color channel to get the hex value for, must be a value between 0 and 255.

returns.description: A string of length 2 characters, i.e. 255 = ff, 100 = 64.

functions.name: HSVColorWheel
functions.description: Get HSV color wheel values in an array which will be 360 elements in size.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: The value, in the range 0 - 1.

returns.description: An array containing 360 elements corresponding to the HSV color wheel.

functions.name: HSLColorWheel
functions.description: Get HSL color wheel values in an array which will be 360 elements in size.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: The lightness, in the range 0 - 1.

returns.description: An array containing 360 elements corresponding to the HSL color wheel.

functions.name: interpolateColor
functions.description: Interpolates the two given colours based on the supplied step and currentStep properties.

parameters.name: color1
parameters.description: The first color value.

parameters.name: color2
parameters.description: The second color value.

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: The number of steps to run the interpolation over.

parameters.name: currentStep
parameters.description: The currentStep value. If the interpolation will take 100 steps, a currentStep value of 50 would be half-way between the two.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The alpha of the returned color.

returns.description: The interpolated color value.

functions.name: interpolateColorWithRGB
functions.description: Interpolates the two given colours based on the supplied step and currentStep properties.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The first color value.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: The number of steps to run the interpolation over.

parameters.name: currentStep
parameters.description: The currentStep value. If the interpolation will take 100 steps, a currentStep value of 50 would be half-way between the two.

returns.description: The interpolated color value.

functions.name: interpolateRGB
functions.description: Interpolates the two given colours based on the supplied step and currentStep properties.

parameters.name: r1
parameters.description: The red color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: g1
parameters.description: The green color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: b1
parameters.description: The blue color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: r2
parameters.description: The red color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: g2
parameters.description: The green color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: b2
parameters.description: The blue color value, between 0 and 0xFF (255).

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: The number of steps to run the interpolation over.

parameters.name: currentStep
parameters.description: The currentStep value. If the interpolation will take 100 steps, a currentStep value of 50 would be half-way between the two.

returns.description: The interpolated color value.

functions.name: getRandomColor
functions.description: Returns a random color value between black and whiteSet the min value to start each channel from the given offset.Set the max value to restrict the maximum color used per channel.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The lowest value to use for the color.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The highest value to use for the color.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The alpha value of the returning color (default 255 = fully opaque).

returns.description: 32-bit color value with alpha.

functions.name: getRGB
functions.description: Return the component parts of a color as an Object with the properties alpha, red, green, blue.Alpha will only be set if it exist in the given color (0xAARRGGBB)

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color in RGB (0xRRGGBB) or ARGB format (0xAARRGGBB).

returns.description: An Object with properties: alpha, red, green, blue (also r, g, b and a). Alpha will only be present if a color value > 16777215 was given.

functions.name: getWebRGB
functions.description: Returns a CSS friendly string value from the given color.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color in RGB (0xRRGGBB), ARGB format (0xAARRGGBB) or an Object with r, g, b, a properties.

returns.description: A string in the format: 'rgba(r,g,b,a)'

functions.name: getAlpha
functions.description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Alpha component, as a value between 0 and 255.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.

returns.description: The Alpha component of the color, will be between 0 and 1 (0 being no Alpha (opaque), 1 full Alpha (transparent)).

functions.name: getAlphaFloat
functions.description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Alpha component as a value between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.

returns.description: The Alpha component of the color, will be between 0 and 1 (0 being no Alpha (opaque), 1 full Alpha (transparent)).

functions.name: getRed
functions.description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Red component, as a value between 0 and 255.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.

returns.description: The Red component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no color, 255 full Red).

functions.name: getGreen
functions.description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Green component, as a value between 0 and 255.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.

returns.description: The Green component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no color, 255 full Green).

functions.name: getBlue
functions.description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Blue component, as a value between 0 and 255.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.

returns.description: The Blue component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no color, 255 full Blue).

functions.name: blendNormal
functions.description: Blends the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLighten
functions.description: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendDarken
functions.description: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendMultiply
functions.description: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituentcolors. Multiplying any color with black produces black;multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendAverage
functions.description: Takes the average of the source and backdrop colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendAdd
functions.description: Adds the source and backdrop colors together and returns the value, up to a maximum of 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendSubtract
functions.description: Combines the source and backdrop colors and returns their value minus 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendDifference
functions.description: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter.Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendNegation
functions.description: Negation blend mode.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendScreen
functions.description: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendExclusion
functions.description: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode, but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendOverlay
functions.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color.Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced, but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendSoftLight
functions.description: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. If the source color is lighter than 0.5, the backdrop is lightened, as if it were dodged; this is useful for adding highlights to a scene. If the source color is darker than 0.5, the backdrop is darkened, as if it were burned in. The degree of lightening or darkening is proportional to the difference between the source color and 0.5; if it is equal to 0.5, the backdrop is unchanged.Painting with pure black or white produces a distinctly darker or lighter area, but does not result in pure black or white. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendHardLight
functions.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. If the source color is lighter than 0.5, the backdrop is lightened, as if it were screened; this is useful for adding highlights to a scene. If the source color is darker than 0.5, the backdrop is darkened, as if it were multiplied; this is useful for adding shadows to a scene. The degree of lightening or darkening is proportional to the difference between the source color and 0.5; if it is equal to 0.5, the backdrop is unchanged.Painting with pure black or white produces pure black or white. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendColorDodge
functions.description: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendColorBurn
functions.description: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.Painting with white produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLinearDodge
functions.description: An alias for blendAdd, it simply sums the values of the two colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLinearBurn
functions.description: An alias for blendSubtract, it simply sums the values of the two colors and subtracts 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLinearLight
functions.description: This blend mode combines Linear Dodge and Linear Burn (rescaled so that neutral colors become middle gray).Dodge applies to values of top layer lighter than middle gray, and burn to darker values.The calculation simplifies to the sum of bottom layer and twice the top layer, subtract 128. The contrast decreases.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendVividLight
functions.description: This blend mode combines Color Dodge and Color Burn (rescaled so that neutral colors become middle gray).Dodge applies when values in the top layer are lighter than middle gray, and burn to darker values.The middle gray is the neutral color. When color is lighter than this, this effectively moves the white point of the bottom layer down by twice the difference; when it is darker, the black point is moved up by twice the difference. The perceived contrast increases.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendPinLight
functions.description: If the backdrop color (light source) is lighter than 50%, the blendDarken mode is used, and colors lighter than the backdrop color do not change.If the backdrop color is darker than 50% gray, colors lighter than the blend color are replaced, and colors darker than the blend color do not change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendHardMix
functions.description: Runs blendVividLight on the source and backdrop colors.If the resulting color is 128 or more, it receives a value of 255; if less than 128, a value of 0.Therefore, all blended pixels have red, green, and blue channel values of either 0 or 255.This changes all pixels to primary additive colors (red, green, or blue), white, or black.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendReflect
functions.description: Reflect blend mode. This mode is useful when adding shining objects or light zones to images.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendGlow
functions.description: Glow blend mode. This mode is a variation of reflect mode with the source and backdrop colors swapped.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendPhoenix
functions.description: Phoenix blend mode. This subtracts the lighter color from the darker color, and adds 255, giving a bright result.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

classes.name: Phaser.Utils.Debug
classes.description: A collection of methods for displaying debug information about game objects.If your game is running in Canvas mode, then you should invoke all of the Debug methods fromyour games `render` function. This is because they are drawn directly onto the game canvasitself, so if you call any debug methods outside of `render` they are likely to be overwrittenby the game itself.If your game is running in WebGL then Debug will create a Sprite that is placed at the top of the Stage display list and bind a canvas textureto it, which must be uploaded every frame. Be advised: this is very expensive, especially in browsers like Firefox. So please only enable Debugin WebGL mode if you really need it (or your desktop can cope with it well) and disable it for production!

constructor.name: Debug
constructor.description: A collection of methods for displaying debug information about game objects.If your game is running in Canvas mode, then you should invoke all of the Debug methods fromyour games `render` function. This is because they are drawn directly onto the game canvasitself, so if you call any debug methods outside of `render` they are likely to be overwrittenby the game itself.If your game is running in WebGL then Debug will create a Sprite that is placed at the top of the Stage display list and bind a canvas textureto it, which must be uploaded every frame. Be advised: this is very expensive, especially in browsers like Firefox. So please only enable Debugin WebGL mode if you really need it (or your desktop can cope with it well) and disable it for production!

classes.name: Phaser.Device
classes.description: Detects device support capabilities and is responsible for device initialization - see {@link Phaser.Device.whenReady whenReady}.This class represents a singleton object that can be accessed directly as `game.device`(or, as a fallback, `Phaser.Device` when a game instance is not available) without the need to instantiate it.Unless otherwise noted the device capabilities are only guaranteed after initialization. Initializationoccurs automatically and is guaranteed complete before {@link Phaser.Game} begins its "boot" phase.Feature detection can be modified in the {@link Phaser.Device.onInitialized onInitialized} signal.When checking features using the exposed properties only the *truth-iness* of the value should be relied uponunless the documentation states otherwise: properties may return `false`, `''`, `null`, or even `undefined`when indicating the lack of a feature.Uses elements from System.js by MrDoob and Modernizr

constructor.name: Device
constructor.description: It is not possible to instantiate the Device class manually.

functions.name: whenReady
functions.description: Add a device-ready handler and ensure the device ready sequence is started.Phaser.Device will _not_ activate or initialize until at least one `whenReady` handler is added,which is normally done automatically be calling `new Phaser.Game(..)`.The handler is invoked when the device is considered "ready", which may be immediatelyif the device is already "ready". See {@link Phaser.Device#deviceReadyAt deviceReadyAt}.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: Callback to invoke when the device is ready. It is invoked with the given context the Phaser.Device object is supplied as the first argument.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context in which to invoke the handler

parameters.name: nonPrimer
parameters.description: If true the device ready check will not be started.

functions.name: _readyCheck
functions.description: Internal method used for checking when the device is ready.This function is removed from Phaser.Device when the device becomes ready.

functions.name: _initialize
functions.description: Internal method to initialize the capability checks.This function is removed from Phaser.Device once the device is initialized.

functions.name: canPlayAudio
functions.description: Check whether the host environment can play audio.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of 'mp3, 'ogg', 'm4a', 'wav', 'webm' or 'opus'.

functions.name: canPlayVideo
functions.description: Check whether the host environment can play video files.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of 'mp4, 'ogg', 'webm' or 'mpeg'.

returns.description: True if the given file type is supported by the browser, otherwise false.

functions.name: isConsoleOpen
functions.description: Check whether the console is open.Note that this only works in Firefox with Firebug and earlier versions of Chrome.It used to work in Chrome, but then they removed the ability: {@link http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink?view=revision&revision=151136}

functions.name: isAndroidStockBrowser
functions.description: Detect if the host is a an Android Stock browser.This is available before the device "ready" event.Authors might want to scale down on effects and switch to the CANVAS rendering method on those devices.

members.name: onInitialized
members.description: This signal is dispatched after device initialization occurs but before any of the readycallbacks (see {@link Phaser.Device.whenReady whenReady}) have been invoked.Local "patching" for a particular device can/should be done in this event._Note_: This signal is removed after the device has been readied; if a handler has not beenadded _before_ `new Phaser.Game(..)` it is probably too late.

classes.name: Phaser.DOM
classes.description: DOM utility class.Provides a useful Window and Element functions as well as cross-browser compatibility buffer.Some code originally derived from {@link https://github.com/ryanve/verge verge}.Some parts were inspired by the research of Ryan Van Etten, released under MIT License 2013.

constructor.name: DOM
constructor.description: DOM utility class.Provides a useful Window and Element functions as well as cross-browser compatibility buffer.Some code originally derived from {@link https://github.com/ryanve/verge verge}.Some parts were inspired by the research of Ryan Van Etten, released under MIT License 2013.

functions.name: getOffset
functions.description: Get the [absolute] position of the element relative to the Document.The value may vary slightly as the page is scrolled due to rounding errors.

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: The targeted element that we want to retrieve the offset.

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: The point we want to take the x/y values of the offset.

returns.description: - A point objet with the offsetX and Y as its properties.

functions.name: getBounds
functions.description: A cross-browser element.getBoundingClientRect method with optional cushion.Returns a plain object containing the properties `top/bottom/left/right/width/height` with respect to the top-left corner of the current viewport.Its properties match the native rectangle.The cushion parameter is an amount of pixels (+/-) to cushion the element.It adjusts the measurements such that it is possible to detect when an element is near the viewport.

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: The element or stack (uses first item) to get the bounds for.

parameters.name: cushion
parameters.description: A +/- pixel adjustment amount.

returns.description: A plain object containing the properties `top/bottom/left/right/width/height` or `false` if a non-valid element is given.

functions.name: calibrate
functions.description: Calibrates element coordinates for `inLayoutViewport` checks.

parameters.name: coords
parameters.description: An object containing the following properties: `{top: number, right: number, bottom: number, left: number}`

parameters.name: cushion
parameters.description: A value to adjust the coordinates by.

returns.description: The calibrated element coordinates

functions.name: getAspectRatio
functions.description: Get the Visual viewport aspect ratio (or the aspect ratio of an object or element)

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object to determine the aspect ratio for. Must have public `width` and `height` properties or methods.

returns.description: The aspect ratio.

functions.name: inLayoutViewport
functions.description: Tests if the given DOM element is within the Layout viewport.The optional cushion parameter allows you to specify a distance.inLayoutViewport(element, 100) is `true` if the element is in the viewport or 100px near it.inLayoutViewport(element, -100) is `true` if the element is in the viewport or at least 100px near it.

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: The DOM element to check. If no element is given it defaults to the Phaser game canvas.

parameters.name: cushion
parameters.description: The cushion allows you to specify a distance within which the element must be within the viewport.

returns.description: True if the element is within the viewport, or within `cushion` distance from it.

functions.name: getScreenOrientation
functions.description: Returns the device screen orientation.Orientation values: 'portrait-primary', 'landscape-primary', 'portrait-secondary', 'landscape-secondary'.Order of resolving:- Screen Orientation API, or variation of - Future track. Most desktop and mobile browsers.- Screen size ratio check - If fallback is 'screen', suited for desktops.- Viewport size ratio check - If fallback is 'viewport', suited for mobile.- window.orientation - If fallback is 'window.orientation', works iOS and probably most Android; non-recommended track.- Media query- Viewport size ratio check (probably only IE9 and legacy mobile gets here..)See- https://w3c.github.io/screen-orientation/ (conflicts with mozOrientation/msOrientation)- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen.orientation (mozOrientation)- http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/dn342934(v=vs.85).aspx- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/CSS/Testing_media_queries- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4917664/detect-viewport-orientation- http://www.matthewgifford.com/blog/2011/12/22/a-misconception-about-window-orientation

parameters.name: primaryFallback
parameters.description: Specify 'screen', 'viewport', or 'window.orientation'.

members.name: visualBounds
members.description: The bounds of the Visual viewport, as discussed in {@link http://www.quirksmode.org/mobile/viewports.html A tale of two viewports — part one}with one difference: the viewport size _excludes_ scrollbars, as found on some desktop browsers.   Supported mobile:  iOS/Safari, Android 4, IE10, Firefox OS (maybe not Firefox Android), Opera Mobile 16The properties change dynamically.

members.name: layoutBounds
members.description: The bounds of the Layout viewport, as discussed in {@link http://www.quirksmode.org/mobile/viewports2.html A tale of two viewports — part two};but honoring the constraints as specified applicable viewport meta-tag.The bounds returned are not guaranteed to be fully aligned with CSS media queries (see{@link http://www.matanich.com/2013/01/07/viewport-size/ What size is my viewport?}).This is _not_ representative of the Visual bounds: in particular the non-primary axis willgenerally be significantly larger than the screen height on mobile devices when running with aconstrained viewport.The properties change dynamically.

members.name: documentBounds
members.description: The size of the document / Layout viewport.This incorrectly reports the dimensions in IE.The properties change dynamically.

members.name: scrollX
members.description: A cross-browser window.scrollX.

members.name: scrollY
members.description: A cross-browser window.scrollY.

classes.name: Phaser.LinkedList
classes.description: A basic Linked List data structure.This implementation _modifies_ the `prev` and `next` properties of each item added:- The `prev` and `next` properties must be writable and should not be used for any other purpose.- Items _cannot_ be added to multiple LinkedLists at the same time.- Only objects can be added.

constructor.name: LinkedList
constructor.description: A basic Linked List data structure.This implementation _modifies_ the `prev` and `next` properties of each item added:- The `prev` and `next` properties must be writable and should not be used for any other purpose.- Items _cannot_ be added to multiple LinkedLists at the same time.- Only objects can be added.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds a new element to this linked list.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to add to this list. Can be a Phaser.Sprite or any other object you need to quickly iterate through.

returns.description: The item that was added.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the first, last, next and previous node pointers in this list.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes the given element from this linked list if it exists.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to be removed from the list.

functions.name: callAll
functions.description: Calls a function on all members of this list, using the member as the context for the callback.The function must exist on the member.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function to call.

members.name: next
members.description: Next element in the list.

members.name: prev
members.description: Previous element in the list.

members.name: first
members.description: First element in the list.

members.name: last
members.description: Last element in the list.

members.name: total
members.description: Number of elements in the list.

parameters.name: game

parameters.name: forceSetTimeOut
parameters.description: Tell Phaser to use setTimeOut even if raf is available.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the requestAnimationFrame running or setTimeout if unavailable in browser

functions.name: updateRAF

functions.name: updateSetTimeout

functions.name: reverseString
functions.description: Takes the given string and reverses it, returning the reversed string.For example if given the string `Atari 520ST` it would return `TS025 iratA`.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string to be reversed.

returns.description: The reversed string.

functions.name: getProperty
functions.description: Gets an objects property by string.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to traverse.

parameters.name: prop
parameters.description: The property whose value will be returned.

returns.description: the value of the property or null if property isn't found .

functions.name: setProperty
functions.description: Sets an objects property by string.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to traverse

parameters.name: prop
parameters.description: The property whose value will be changed

returns.description: The object on which the property was set.

functions.name: chanceRoll
functions.description: Generate a random bool result based on the chance value.Returns true or false based on the chance value (default 50%). For example if you wanted a player to have a 30% chanceof getting a bonus, call chanceRoll(30) - true means the chance passed, false means it failed.

parameters.name: chance
parameters.description: The chance of receiving the value. A number between 0 and 100 (effectively 0% to 100%).

returns.description: True if the roll passed, or false otherwise.

functions.name: randomChoice
functions.description: Choose between one of two values randomly.

returns.description: The randomly selected choice

functions.name: parseDimension
functions.description: Get a unit dimension from a string.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size to parse.

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: The window dimension to check.

returns.description: The parsed dimension.

functions.name: pad
functions.description: Takes the given string and pads it out, to the length required, using the characterspecified. For example if you need a string to be 6 characters long, you can call:`pad('bob', 6, '-', 2)`This would return: `bob---` as it has padded it out to 6 characters, using the `-` on the right.You can also use it to pad numbers (they are always returned as strings):`pad(512, 6, '0', 1)`Would return: `000512` with the string padded to the left.If you don't specify a direction it'll pad to both sides:`pad('c64', 7, '*')`Would return: `**c64**`

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The target string. `toString()` will be called on the string, which means you can also pass in common data types like numbers.

parameters.name: len
parameters.description: The number of characters to be added.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.description: The string to pad it out with (defaults to a space).

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: The direction dir = 1 (left), 2 (right), 3 (both).

returns.description: The padded string.

functions.name: isPlainObject
functions.description: This is a slightly modified version of jQuery.isPlainObject.A plain object is an object whose internal class property is [object Object].

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to inspect.

returns.description: - true if the object is plain, otherwise false.

functions.name: extend
functions.description: This is a slightly modified version of http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.extend/

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: Perform a deep copy?

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target object to copy to.

returns.description: The extended object.

functions.name: mixinPrototype
functions.description: Mixes in an existing mixin object with the target.Values in the mixin that have either `get` or `set` functions are created as properties via `defineProperty`_except_ if they also define a `clone` method - if a clone method is defined that is called instead andthe result is assigned directly.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target object to receive the new functions.

parameters.name: mixin
parameters.description: The object to copy the functions from.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: If the target object already has a matching function should it be overwritten or not?

functions.name: mixin
functions.description: Mixes the source object into the destination object, returning the newly modified destination object.Based on original code by @mudcube

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The object to copy (the source object).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The object to copy to (the destination object).

returns.description: The modified destination object.
